text2: Xpe José , xcˈambˈi jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús , xbˈatzˈbˈi laˈ jun itzˈik ri jbˈij lino ri taˈ tzˈil laˈ

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: y xeˈ jmukeˈ li jun nimlaj aacˈ jul ri cˈotol li abˈaj re mukbˈi camnak . Man jul li rechiˈ re bˈanal jwiˈl . Cuando xyeˈmaj jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl claˈ , xcan jtzˈapij jchiˈ man jul laˈ jun nimlaj abˈaj y xecˈ .

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: María Magdalena pach jun María chic xcan cubˈartak chiwch man jul lamas xyeˈsaj jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Laj jcabˈ kˈij re jmukic Kakaj Jesús riˈ kˈij re uxlan . Laˈ man kˈij li xpetak mak jbˈabˈalak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios pach mak fariseo xeˈtak riqˈui Pilato .

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: Xijtak re : Kaj , xcuxtaj kawiˈl chi man joˈslaj winak li cuando aj yoˈlna xij chi tina cˈastasajna jwich laj jcamnakl laj jrox kˈij .

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Jwiˈliˈli riˈ mas tzi tatakbˈi soldad chi jchajaj man jul lamas xmuksajwiˈ asta tiel uxibˈ kˈij , jwiˈl taˈ cˈaxreˈ wi tipetak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij tiyuk resajtak jcamnakl lakˈabˈ tibˈe jmukeˈtak chic li jun jalan luwar y tijbˈijtak rechak cristian chi xcˈastasajiˈbˈi jwich laj jcamnakl xoˈlak camnakibˈ . Wi xantak jilonli man qˈuisbˈi joˈslaj tzij tibˈe mas chi nim chiwch man nabˈe joˈslaj tzij , xcheˈtak re Pilato .

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: Pilato xij rechak : Coˈ nicˈj soldad li , jattak , cˈamtakbˈic y tzi jtzˈapij man jul tibˈe abˈaneˈtak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Rechak xeˈtak xcojtak jun retal laˈ man abˈaj ri cojol chiˈ man jul pire ticˈutun wi wiˈ nen titebˈan re y xcan jyeˈtak mak soldad li claˈ chi jchajajc .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Cuando xkˈax man kˈij re uxlan y xsakarsan li nabˈe kˈij re xuman , María Magdalena pach jun María chic xeˈtak chiˈ jul lamas xyeˈsajwiˈ jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: Etke xpe jun nimlaj cabˈrakn jwiˈl wiˈ jun ranjl Kakaj Dios ri Kajawl xkejch lecj y xjutun chiˈ jul lamas xyeˈsajwiˈ jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús , xsolcopijbˈi man abˈaj ri cojol chiˈ man jul y xcubˈar chibˈ .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Man anjl li subˈlaj tikopopon rij chapcaˈ coyop y ritzˈik subˈlaj sak chapcaˈ jsakil chun tew .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: Mak soldad , cuando xriltak jwich anjl , subˈlaj xtzaak jchˈolak y tichak querquentak jwiˈl tzakom chˈolal y xcantak chapcaˈ camnaktak .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: Xpe anjl , xij rechak yak anm : Mi tzaak achˈolak . In wetamiˈ chi riˈ tijin tatoctak Kakaj Jesús ri xcamsaj wich curs .

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: Re taˈ chiquiˈ neri , xcˈastasajiˈbˈi jwich laj jcamnakl chapcaˈ ri bˈil jwiˈl . Tzajtak , yuk awileˈtak lamas xyeˈsaj jcamnakl , taˈ chiquiˈ nen wiˈ .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: Jattak laj or , bˈijtatak rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij chi xcˈastasajiˈbˈi jwich laj jcamnakl y tinabˈeriˈbˈi chawchak atbˈetak Galilea , claˈ tibˈe awileˈtak jwich . Xike li ri tambˈij chawechak , xcheˈ anjl rechak yak anm .

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: Yak anm li , laj or xeltakbˈi chiˈ jul lamas xyeˈsajwiˈ jcamnakl Kakaj Jesús . Junquitz tzakal jchˈolak y junquitz tiquiˈcottak , xeˈtak jol xeˈ jbˈijtak rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesucristo .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Cuando bˈesaltak yak anm li bˈe , etke xcˈul ribˈak pach Kakaj Jesús y xcˈamsaj rutzil jwichak . Rechak xjutuntak chijcˈulel , xxucartak , xkˈalujtak rakan y xnimirsajtak jkˈij .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Mi tzaak achˈolak , bˈijtatak rechak yak inkˈun chi tibˈetak Galilea . Claˈ tibˈe rileˈtak inwch , xcheˈ rechak .

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Cuando bˈesaltak yak anm li bˈe , xpetak nicˈj mak soldad ri wiˈtak chi jchajaj man jul , xeˈtak li tilmit chi jbˈij rechak mak jbˈabˈalak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios juntir ri xriltak .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: Xpetak mak jbˈabˈalak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios , xeˈ jchˈabˈejtak yak ri wiˈ rekleˈnak chijxoˈlak yak rijajl Israel , xchomorsajtak chiribˈil ribˈak chi tijyeˈtak subˈlaj pwak rechak mak soldad pire maˈ tijbˈijtak ri xriltak .

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: Xijtak rechak mak soldad : Atak bˈijtak jilonri : Lakˈabˈ cuando xeˈ kawarj , xtawtak mak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Jesús , xresajtak jcamnakl , xcˈamtakbˈic , atcheˈtak .

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: Y wi xta man jbˈabˈal kˈatbˈitzij juntir ri xaanc , oj ojchomorsan riqˈuil , atak mi tzaak achˈolak , atkacolaˈtakaˈ pire taˈ nen tran chawechak , xcheˈtak re mak soldad .

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Mak soldad xcˈultak man pwak y xantak chapcaˈ ri xijsaj rechak . Jilonli xresajtak jtaquil chi taˈ tzˈet xcˈastasaj jwich Kakaj Jesús laj jcamnakl , asta lajori ajwichiˈ jilon jtaquil chijxoˈlak yak rijajl Israel .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Yak junlajuj ( 11 ) ajtijol ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesucristo xeˈtak Galilea pire tibˈetak laˈ man witz ri xijsaj rechak jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: Cuando xriltak jwich Kakaj Jesús xnimirsajtak jkˈij , pero wiˈ jujun rechak taˈ kes tijcojtak wi riˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xjutun riqˈuilak y xij rechak : Kakaj Dios xyaˈ kˈatbˈitzij laj inkˈbˈ pire intakon chibˈak juntir ri wiˈtak lecj y juntir ri wiˈtak wich ulew .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Lajori jattak riqˈuilak juntir cristian wich ulew , tijojtak pire tioctak pi ajtijol ribˈak chwij . Bˈantak jaˈtiox rechak laj jbˈij Kakaj Dios , laj jbˈij Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios y laj jbˈij Lokˈlaj Jsantil Kakaj Dios .

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: Y tijojtak chi jbˈanic juntir ri ximbˈij chawechak . In , inwaˈxiˈ aacˈlak nojel kˈij asta tiqˈuis jwich kˈijsak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: Jilonri xticarch ri tzilaj jtaquil chirij Kakaj Jesucristo , ri Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios .

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Jilon xcan jtzˈibˈaj Isaías ri ajkˈasal Jyolj Kakaj Dios cuando Kakaj Dios xij jilonri : Tina intaknabˈi intakoˈn nabˈe chawch pire tijbˈij rechak cristian chi rajwaxiˈ tijqˈuex jnoˈjak chinwch nicˈ riqˈuil tran jwaˈx jun abˈe .

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Y tina tasajna jun ri cow tichˈejej li jun luwar lamas taˈ cristian , ri tijbˈij jilonri : Bˈantak jwaˈx jbˈe Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl , tebˈaˈtak jbˈe sucˈul laj awanmak , ticheˈ , xcheˈ Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Isaías .

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: Jilonli , cuando xpe Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox chi jbˈanic jaˈtiox rechak cristian li jun luwar lamas taˈ cristian , xij rechak chi rajwaxiˈ tijqˈuex jnoˈjak pire ticuysaj juntir jmacak jwiˈl Kakaj Dios y tibˈansaj jaˈtiox rechak .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Subˈlaj cristian ri tipetak lak macˈultak luwar re Judea y tipetak Jerusalén xtawtak chi jtaic jxolj Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox . Lawiˈ ri xcˈam jkˈabˈal jmacak chiwch Kakaj Dios , Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox xan jaˈtiox rechak li nimi jaˈ Jordán .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: Ritzˈik Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox ri tijcoj bˈanal laˈ rusumal camello y jpas bˈanal laˈ tzˈum y sacˈ pach cabˈ re lak cheˈ tijtij pire jwa .

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox xij rechak cristian : Petzal chiquiˈ jun chwij mas jcwinel chinwch in . In taˈ ticˈular pi we intacar chi jquiric jcˈamul jxajbˈ .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: In kes tzˈet laˈ jaˈ ximbˈan jaˈtiox chawechak , pero re tina ranna jaˈtiox chawechak laˈ Lokˈlaj Jsantil Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox rechak cristian .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: Laˈ mak kˈij li , Kakaj Jesús xelch Nazaret ri jun tilmit re Galilea y xtaw riqˈui Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox y re xan jaˈtiox re Kakaj Jesús li nimi jaˈ Jordán .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: Cuando tijin tielch Kakaj Jesús ralaj jaˈ , xril xtormaj caj y kesalch Lokˈlaj Jsantil Kakaj Dios chibˈ chapcaˈ rilic jun ra ut .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Xtasaj jun chˈaˈwem xaanch lecj , xijch : Atiˈ ri lokˈlaj Incˈajol , subˈlaj inquiˈcot chawij , xcheˈch .

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xpe Lokˈlaj Jsantil Kakaj Dios , xcˈambˈi Kakaj Jesús li jun luwar lamas taˈ cristian .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xwaˈx caˈwinak ( 40 ) kˈij claˈ ricˈan . Xwaˈx xoˈlak awaj re lak cheˈ . Xpe man jbˈabˈal etzl , xtakchiˈj Kakaj Jesús chi macunc . Pero xpetak yak anjl xyuktak chi jtˈoˈic Kakaj Jesús .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Cuando wiˈchak Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox li cars , Kakaj Jesús xeˈ Galilea chi jbˈij re juntir cristian tzilaj jtaquil chirij jtakon Kakaj Dios .

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: Y xij rechak : Xtawiˈ kˈij , raquitzchak raj tijchol takon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian . Qˈuex anoˈjak chiwch Kakaj Dios y cojtak riqˈui nojel awanmak tzilaj jtaquil chwij , xcheˈ rechak .

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús tijin tiwoˈcot chiˈ nimlaj alagun re Galilea , xril jwichak Simón pach Andrés ri jkˈun . Rechak ajchapaltak cartakaˈn , tijin tijtˈoj jcˈaatak li jaˈ re chapbˈi car .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Joˈtak chwij y in atincojaˈtakaˈ chi jtoquic cristian pire tioctak laj jkˈabˈ Kakaj Dios chapcaˈ jchapic car tabˈantak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: Rechak laj or xcan jyeˈ jcˈaatak re chapbˈi car y xeˈtak chirij Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xbˈen chicbˈi junquitz y xril chicbˈi jwichak yak jcˈajol Zebedeo , riˈtakaˈ Santiago pach Juan ri jkˈun , rechak wiˈtak li jun barc tijin tijcˈojaj jcˈaatak re chapbˈi car .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xsiqˈuijtakbˈic . Y rechak xcan jyeˈtak jkajak li barc pach yak jmocomak y xeˈtak chirij Kakaj Jesús .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: Xtawtak Capernaúm . Laˈ kˈij re uxlan Kakaj Jesús xoc li sinagog y xoc chi jtijojcak cristian .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for he taught them as one that had authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Cristian xsaach jchˈolak chi jtaic , jwiˈl wiˈ mas jnoˈj chi tijonc . Maˈ jiˈtaˈlon chapcaˈ titijontak yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios .

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit ; and he cried out ,
text2: Y li sinagog xtaw jun winak chijxoˈlak ri wiˈ etzl laj ranm . Xpe man etzl , cow xchˈejejc , xij :

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of God .
text2: ¡ Nen ma bˈan chike at Kaj Jesús aj Nazaret ! Wetamiˈ chi at tosolcatiˈ jwiˈl Kakaj Dios pire re y chi jbˈaniquiˈ cˈax chike xatpetc , xcheˈ .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xkˈel man etzl ri wiˈ laj ranm man winak , xij re : ¡ Tzˈapij xaˈw ! ¡ Elambˈi laj ranm winak ri ! xcheˈ re .

text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he came out of him .
text2: Man etzl xyeˈ jun quiekˈekˈ re man winak y cow xchˈejej cuando xelbˈi laj ranm .

text: And they were all amazed , insomuch that they questioned among themselves , saying , What thing is this ? what new doctrine is this ? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits , and they do obey him .
text2: Juntir cristian xsaach jchˈolak . Xtzˈonajtak chiribˈil ribˈak : ¿ Nen chiquiˈ ri ? ¿ Nen chiquiˈ jcholajl man aacˈ cˈutuˈn ri ? Winak ri wiˈ kˈatbˈitzij laj jkˈabˈ pire titakon chibˈak mak etzl y ticojontakaˈ chiwch , xcheˈtak .

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee .
text2: Laj or xtaw jtaquil juntir ri xan Kakaj Jesús lak juntir luwar re Galilea .

text: And forthwith , when they were come out of the synagogue , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús pach Santiago y Juan xeltakbˈi li sinagog , xeˈtak laj richochak Simón Pedro y Andrés .

text: But Simon ' s wife ' s mother lay sick of a fever , and anon they tell him of her .
text2: Y sicˈ anm ri jjiˈ Simón Pedro kesal laj jsoc jwiˈl kˈakˈ chirij . Xijtak re Kakaj Jesús chi anm yajiˈn .

text: And he came and took her by the hand , and lifted her up ; and immediately the fever left her , and she ministered unto them .
text2: Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xjutun chijcˈulel jchˈat sicˈ anm y xchap chi jkˈabˈ y xbˈit . Laj or xel man kˈakˈ chirij y xoc chi jtzukicak juntir ri wiˈtak la ja .

text: And at even , when the sun did set , they brought unto him all that were diseased , and them that were possessed with devils .
text2: Cuando xoc may , xpetak cristian aj Capernaúm , xcˈamtakch riqˈui Kakaj Jesús juntir cristian ri wiˈ yajel rechak pach ri wiˈ etzl laj ranmak .

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door .
text2: Juntir cristian ri wiˈtak li tilmit xmulbˈaˈ ribˈak chuchja .

text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases , and cast out many devils ; and suffered not the devils to speak , because they knew him .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzibˈsaj subˈlaj qˈui rechak re jaljojtak yajel ri wiˈ rechak y xresaj mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak . Y Kakaj Jesús taˈ xyeˈ luwar rechak mak etzl tichˈaˈwtak jwiˈl rechak retamakiˈ lamas xpeˈw .

text: And in the morning , rising up a great while before day , he went out , and departed into a solitary place , and there prayed .
text2: Subˈlaj akˈabˈ , aj ukuˈmna Kakaj Jesús xelbˈi Capernaúm . Xeˈ li jun luwar ricˈan lamas taˈ cristian pire tichˈaˈw riqˈui Kakaj Dios .

text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him .
text2: Simón Pedro y mak jpach xeˈtak chi jtoquic .

text: And when they had found him , they said unto him , All men seek for thee .
text2: Cuando xeˈ jteˈtak Kakaj Jesús , xijtak re : Juntir cristian tijintak chi atoquic , xcheˈtak re .

text: And he said unto them , Let us go into the next towns , that I may preach there also : for therefore came I forth .
text2: Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xij rechak : Joˈtak laˈ mak tra luwar chic chi nakaj . Inna bˈena chi jtijojcak cristian claˈ , jwiˈl riˈ li quiek jwiˈl petzalquin , xcheˈ .

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee , and cast out devils .
text2: Jilonli Kakaj Jesús xwoˈcot lak juntir luwar re Galilea chi jtijojcak cristian lak sinagog y xresaj mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak cristian .

text: And there came a leper to him , beseeching him , and kneeling down to him , and saying unto him , If thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Xpe jun sicˈ winak ri wiˈ yajel chirij ri jbˈij lepra , xjutun chiwch Kakaj Jesús , xxucar chi jtzˈonaj tokˈobˈ re : Wi jilon chawaj , atcwiniˈ chi intzibˈsaj , xcheˈ re .

text: And Jesus , moved with compassion , put forth his hand , and touched him , and saith unto him , I will ; be thou clean .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xril cˈur jwich , xyeˈ jkˈabˈ chibˈ , xij re : Chwajiˈn , cattzibˈok , xcheˈ re .

text: And as soon as he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
text2: Y laj or xel man yajel chirij sicˈ winak y xtzibˈc .

text: And he straitly charged him , and forthwith sent him away ;
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xij re :

text: And saith unto him , See thou say nothing to any man : but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Ta impuch , ma yolow re jono cristian nen xattzibˈsanc . Jat cˈutta chiwch man ajcˈamal jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios y cˈambˈi man sipan pire tibˈe asujeˈ re Kakaj Dios chapcaˈ tijbˈij Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios , riˈ li cˈutbˈire chiwchak juntir cristian chi xattzibˈiˈn , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús re .

text: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they came to him from every quarter .
text2: Man winak xecˈ , pero taˈ xcoj ri xijsaj re jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , xoc chi jyolic rechak juntir cristian ri nen xansaj re pire xtzibˈc . Jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús taˈ chiquiˈ tijnaˈ tioc xoˈlak cristian , ni li jono tilmit . Jiˈchak tiwoˈcot chinaj lamas ri mitaˈ cristian , pero tiyuktakaˈ cristian re jaljojtak luwar riqˈuil .

text: And again he entered into Capernaum , after some days ; and it was noised that he was in the house .
text2: Kˈasalchak quibˈ uxibˈ kˈij , cuando xtaw chic Kakaj Jesús Capernaúm , xtasaj jtaquil jwiˈlak cristian chi wiˈchak chic la ja .

text: And straightway many were gathered together , insomuch that there was no room to receive them , no , not so much as about the door : and he preached the word unto them .
text2: Xmol ribˈak subˈlaj cristian , taˈ chiquiˈ titzˈakattak chiˈ pwert . Cuando Kakaj Jesús tijin tijbˈij Jyolj Kakaj Dios rechak ,

text: And they come unto him , bringing one sick of the palsy , which was borne of four .
text2: xtawtak quejabˈ winak cˈamalbˈi jun winak jwiˈlak bˈa chˈatum cheˈ ri siquirnak juntir jtioˈjl .

text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press , they uncovered the roof where he was : and when they had broken it up , they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay .
text2: Pero taˈ tijnaˈ tioctak riqˈui Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl subˈlaj cristian wiˈtak chiˈ pwert , rechak xjawtak chibˈ man ja . Xtortak junquitz mak xoot bˈa ja laj jsucˈlal lamas wiˈ Kakaj Jesús y claˈ xkesajtak sicˈ yaj bˈa jchˈatum cheˈ .

text: When Jesus saw their faith , he said unto the sick of the palsy , Son , thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús xril chi cubˈuliˈ jchˈolak chirij , xij re sicˈ winak ri yaj : At walcˈwal , amac xcuymajiˈn , xcheˈ re .

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there , and reasoning in their hearts ,
text2: Xpetak nicˈj ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri cubˈultak claˈ , xchomorsajtak laj ranmak , xijtak :

text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies ? who can forgive sins but God only ?
text2: ¿ Nen chac tijbˈij man winak ri jilonli ? Re tijin tijcoj ribˈ pi Kakaj Dios . Taˈ ni jun cristian ticwin chi jcuyic mac , xike Kakaj Dios , xcheˈtak .

text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , he said unto them , Why reason ye these things in your hearts ?
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús xretemajiˈ laj ranm nen tijin tijchomorsaj laj ranmak y xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Nen chac tijin tachomorsajtak laj awanmak jilonli ?

text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: ¿ Lacˈumas wiˈ ri mas cˈax jbˈij re sicˈ yaj , amac xcuymajiˈn o riˈ mas cˈax jbˈij , bˈiiten , cˈambˈi achˈatum cheˈ y woˈcoten ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( he saith to the sick of the palsy , )
text2: Pero in tancˈut chawchak chi Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil wiˈ kˈatbˈitzij laj jkˈabˈ chi jcuyic mac neri wich ulew , xcheˈ rechak . Ajrucˈreˈ xij chic re sicˈ winak ri siquirnak jtioˈjl .

text: I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy bed , and go thy way into thine house .
text2: Tambˈij chawe at , bˈiiten , cˈambˈi achˈatum cheˈ y jat laj awichoch , xcheˈ re .

text: And immediately he arose , took up the bed , and went forth before them all ; insomuch that they were all amazed , and glorified God , saying , We never saw it on this fashion .
text2: Sicˈ winak ri yaj xbˈiitc , xcˈambˈi jchˈatum cheˈ y xelbˈi chiwchak juntir cristian . Juntir cristian cuando xriltak jilonli , subˈlaj xsaach jchˈolak y xoctak chi jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios , xijtak : ¡ Ni jun bˈwelt ilan jun kelen kawiˈl jilonri ! xcheˈtak .

text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xeˈ chic chiˈ nimlaj alagun y subˈlaj cristian xtawtak riqˈuil . Re xtijojtak re Jyolj Kakaj Dios .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: Kˈaxem xan Kakaj Jesús cuando xrilbˈi Leví ri jcˈajol Alfeo , cubˈul chiˈ mex lamas titojsaj alcabar y Kakaj Jesús xij re : Joˈ chwij , xcheˈ re . Leví xwaˈrc y xeˈ chirij Kakaj Jesús .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús tijin chi wicˈ laj richoch Leví , subˈlaj qˈui ajtzˈonaltak alcabar y subˈlaj qˈui ajmacbˈ xcubˈartak chi wicˈ riqˈui Kakaj Jesús pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij y subˈlaj qˈui ribˈilak .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Cuando yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri riˈtakaˈ jun chijxoˈlak mak fariseo xriltak chi Kakaj Jesús tijin tiwiˈn chijxoˈlak mak ajmacbˈ pach mak ajtzˈonaltak alcabar , xsaach jchˈolak y xtzˈonajtak rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesucristo : ¿ Nen chac ajtijol awechak tijin tiwiˈn chijxoˈlak mak ajtzˈonaltak alcabar pach mak ajmacbˈ ? xcheˈtak .

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Cuando xta Kakaj Jesús chi jilonli xijsaj rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij , xij rechak yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri riˈtakaˈ jun chijxoˈlak mak fariseo : Taˈ rajwax ajcun rechak yak cristian ri taˈ yajtak , riˈ rajwax ajcun pi rechak yak ri yajtak . In taˈ ximpe chi jtoquic yak cristian ri sucˈul ranmak chiwch Kakaj Dios , in riˈ ximpe chi jtoquic yak ajmacbˈ , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Jun kˈij cuando yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox pach mak ajtijol ribˈak chirijak mak fariseo tijin trantak ayun , xpetak nicˈj cristian riqˈui Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonajtak re : ¿ Nen chac yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox pach mak ajtijol ribˈak chirijak mak fariseo tranaˈtakaˈ ayun y yak ajtijol ribˈak chawij at taˈ trantak ayun ? xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Yak cristian ri bˈil rechak chi tibˈetak li jun tzˈam , taˈ tijnaˈ tibˈisontak cuando ajwiˈ man cˈojol winak chijxoˈlak ri ticˈuliˈyc .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Pero cuando titaw kˈij ticˈamsajbˈi man cˈojol winak chiwchak , ajrucˈreˈ trantak ayun .

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Taˈ ni jono cristian tijcˈojaj jun tzay itzˈik laˈ jun qˈuer aacˈ cˈojbˈl , jwiˈl man aacˈ cˈojbˈl , tijcˈolaˈ ribˈ y tike niman mas man rechˈeˈl re man tzay itzˈik .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Ni taˈ tijnaˈ tiyeˈsaj aacˈ vin lak tzaytak nejbˈ ri bˈanal laˈ tzˈum , jwiˈl man aacˈ vin tijrechˈaˈ mak tzaytak nejbˈ ri bˈanal laˈ tzˈum , jilonli titixiˈ man aacˈ vin y tranaˈ cˈax mak nejbˈ . Jwiˈliˈli man aacˈ vin rajwaxiˈ lak aacˈtak nejbˈ ri bˈanal laˈ tzˈum tiyeˈsaj , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: Li jun kˈij re uxlan woˈcotic tran Kakaj Jesús xkˈaxtak lak ticoˈn pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij . Rechak pi kˈaxem trantak xtoctak jujun jwich trig y xtijtak .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: Xpetak mak fariseo , xijtak re Kakaj Jesús : ¡ Il impuch ! ¿ Nen chac yak ajtijol ribˈak chawij tijin trantak ri taˈ yeˈl luwar tibˈansaj laˈ kˈij re uxlan ? xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Taˈcˈu ilan awiˈlak li wuj re Lokˈlaj Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri xan David ojr pach yak jpach cuando xcˈoktak wiˈjal ?

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Re xoc li nimlaj chinam ri richoch Kakaj Dios cuando Abiatar wiˈ pi nimlaj jbˈabˈalak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios , xtij mak cuxlanwa ri sujul re Kakaj Dios y xyeˈ chi tijem rechak yak jpach onque taˈ yeˈl luwar jwiˈl Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios chi titijsaj , xike rechak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios yeˈl luwar rechak tijtijtak .

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: Man kˈij re uxlan xansaj pirechiˈ cristian y maˈ cristian taˈ xansaj pire man kˈij re uxlan .

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Jwiˈliˈli Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil wiˈ laj jkˈabˈ nen raj tran laˈ man kˈij re uxlan , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xoc chic li sinagog . Claˈ wiˈ jun winak ri siquirnak jun jkˈabˈ .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: Jujun rechak mak fariseo cow triltak Kakaj Jesús wi tijtzibˈsajiˈ man winak li laˈ kˈij re uxlan pire tijcojtak tzij chirij .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xij re man winak ri siquirnak jun jkˈabˈ : Bˈiiten , waˈren laj kaxoˈl , xcheˈ re .

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Nen yeˈl luwar ri tibˈansaj laˈ kˈij re uxlan , jbˈanic utzil o jbˈanic cˈax ? ¿ Tziniˈ jcolic jun cristian laj jkˈabˈ camic o jsachic jwich ? xcheˈ rechak . Pero rechak taˈ xchˈaˈwtak .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xpe retzal chi rilicak yak ri sutuwinaktak rij y xcˈaxcˈobˈ laj ranm jwiˈl taˈ rajak tijtatak jcholajl . Kakaj Jesús xij re sicˈ winak ri siquirnak jkˈabˈ : Yuk akˈbˈ , xcheˈ re . Y sicˈ winak li xyuk jkˈabˈ y xtzibˈc .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Mak fariseo xike xeltakbˈic , xoctak chi jchomorsaj riqˈuilak man kˈat ri jpach Herodes nen trantak chi jcamsaj Kakaj Jesús .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: Kakaj Jesús pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xeˈtak chiˈ nimlaj alagun y subˈlaj cristian aj Galilea xambˈertak chirij .

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: Y cuando xtatak jtaquil chirij juntir ri bˈanal jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , subˈlaj cristian xpetak chi rilic , wiˈ xpetak lak luwar re Judea , Jerusalén , Idumea , chˈakap nimi jaˈ Jordán y lak luwar re Tiro pach Sidón .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xril chi subˈlaj cristian tijin tijmulbˈaˈ ribˈak chirij . Xchomorsaj chi mas tilatzˈujc , jwiˈliˈli xij rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij chi tijtoctak jun barc pire lamas tiwaˈxwiˈ .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Xtasaj jtaquil chi subˈlaj cristian xtzibˈsaj jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , jwiˈliˈli xpetak mas cristian ri yajtak y tichak jtucˈ ribˈak chi jchapic Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl riˈ rajak titzibˈsajtak re jyajak .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: Y mak cristian ri wiˈ etzl laj ranmak cuando xriltak jwich Kakaj Jesús xxucaj ribˈak chiwch Kakaj Jesús y mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak , xchˈejejtak chi jbˈijc : ¡ Atiˈ Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ! xcheˈtak re .

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak mak etzl chi mi jbˈijtak chi re Jcˈajoliˈ Kakaj Dios .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xjaw bˈa jun witz y xsiqˈuij yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij ri raj xsiqˈuij .

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: Y jilonli xchaˈ cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) winak y xcoj jbˈijak pi takoˈn pire tiwaˈxtak riqˈuil y pire tijtakbˈi chi jbˈij Jyolj Kakaj Dios . Jilonli xcan jbˈijak pi takoˈn .

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: Y xyeˈ cwinel rechak chi resaj mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak cristian .

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: Riˈtakaˈ ri yak cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) ri xchaˈ , Simón ri xcojsaj jbˈij pi Pedro jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús ,

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: Santiago pach jkˈun ri jbˈij Juan ri yak jcˈajol Zebedeo ri xcojsaj jbˈijak jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús pi Boanerges , ri jcholajl tielwiˈ man bˈij Boanerges , ralcˈwal quiekuljaw ,

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: Andrés , Felipe , Bartolomé , Mateo , Tomás , Santiago ri jcˈajol Alfeo , Tadeo , Simón ri tibˈijsaj Zelote re

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: y Judas Iscariote ri xjachow re Kakaj Jesús pi camic .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xoc li jun ja . Xmulbˈaˈ chic ribˈak subˈlaj qˈui cristian la ja claˈ y jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús taˈ chiquiˈ tijnaˈ tijtij jwaak pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: Cuando jchuch pach jkˈun xtatak jtaquil chi wiˈchak li jun ja claˈ , xeˈtak chi jcˈamic jwiˈl tibˈijsaj chirij chi xtaˈ jchˈuˈjarc .

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: Y nicˈj ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri xpetak Jerusalén , xijtak : Man winak li wiˈ Beelzebú laj ranm y laˈke jcwinel Beelzebú li , ri man jbˈabˈalak mak etzl ticwin chi resaj mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak cristian , xcheˈtak .

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xsiqˈuij mak cristian y xij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri : Man jbˈabˈal etzl taˈ ticwin chi resaj man jbˈabˈal etzl .

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: Juntir kˈatbˈitzij , wi tijjach ribˈak y tioctak chi chˈoˈj chiribˈil ribˈak , tijsachaˈ jwichak .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: Y jun tilmit o yak echˈelxic li jun ja , wi tijtos ribˈak y tioctak chi chˈoˈj chiribˈil ribˈak taˈ naj tijcuytak jilonli .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: Y jiˈcˈulonli witi man jbˈabˈal etzl tijin chi resaj man jbˈabˈal etzl , tijiniˈ tran cˈax ribˈ ricˈan . Wi jilonli tran man jbˈabˈal etzl , tisaachiˈ jwich ricˈan .

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Jun cristian ri wiˈ mas jchokˈbˈ taˈ ni jonok ticwin tioc laj richoch chi resaj kelen re . Nabˈe tina jximna , ajrucˈreˈ tijnaˈ tresaj kelen re , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: Y xij chic : Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak chi Kakaj Dios tijcuyaˈ jmacak juntir cristian y juntir mak yokˈon ri trantak chirij Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil .

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: Pero nen jonok tiyokˈon chirij Lokˈlaj Jsantil Kakaj Dios taˈ ni jun bˈwelt ticuysaj jmac jwiˈl Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: Jilonli xij Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios tijin tijbˈijtak chi re wiˈ etzl laj ranm .

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Jchuch Kakaj Jesús pach yak jkˈun xtawtak chi jchˈabˈej . Jiˈke xcantak chuchja y xtaktak jsiqˈuij Kakaj Jesús .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: Subˈlaj cristian cubˈultak chirij Kakaj Jesús , rechak xijtak re : Achuch pach yak akˈun wiˈtak chuchja y rajak atjchˈabˈejtak , xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : ¿ Nencˈu inchuch y nencˈu inkˈun ? xcheˈ .

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: Y xril mak cristian ri cubˈultak chirij y xij : Riˈtakaˈ rechak ri inchuch pach inkˈun .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Nen raj tran lawiˈ raj Kakaj Dios tran , riˈ li inkˈun , wanabˈ y inchuch , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: Li jun kˈij chic xoc Kakaj Jesús chi jtijoj cristian re Jyolj Kakaj Dios chiˈ nimlaj alagun . Subˈlaj cristian xmulbˈaˈ ribˈak lamas wiˈ Kakaj Jesús . Jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús xjaw li jun barc ri wiˈ chiˈ nimlaj alagun . Xcubˈar claˈ y juntir cristian xcantak chiˈ nimlaj alagun chi jtaic nen tijbˈij rechak .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xoc chi jtijojcak re subˈlaj kelen laˈ esbˈitak noˈj , xij rechak :

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: Tatak impuch . Wiˈ jun ajticonl xeˈ ticonanok .

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: Cuando tijin chi ticonanc , nicˈj íjaj xkejtak li bˈe y xpetak mak tzˈiquin xtijtak .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: Nicˈj íjaj chic xkejtak xoˈlak abˈaj lamas taˈ pim ulew . Mak íjaj li , laj or xeltakch jwiˈl taˈ mas naj jpam man ulew lamas xkejtakwiˈ .

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: Pero jwiˈl taˈ lamas xeˈ raˈak cuando xel sakˈj , xchekejtak y xcamtak .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: Y nicˈj íjaj chic xkejtak lak qˈuix , xeltakaˈch , pero mak qˈuix xqˈuiytak laj or chiwchak , jwiˈliˈli xcam mak ticoˈn ralaj mak qˈuix y taˈ xwichintak .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Nicˈj íjaj chic xkejtak li tzilaj ulew . Mak íjaj li jor kus xwichintak . Wiˈ jujun íjaj xyaˈtakaˈ junwinak lajuj ( 30 ) jwichak . Nicˈj chic xyaˈtakaˈ oxcˈal ( 60 ) jwichak y nicˈj chic xyaˈtakaˈ jujun cient ( 100 ) jwichak .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Nen titonc , jteˈ jcholajl ri tambˈij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak cristian .

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: Cuando xeˈtak jqˈuiyal cristian , Kakaj Jesús xcan xichak jpach yak cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) ajtijol ribˈak chirij pach nicˈj ri xamtak chirij xtzˈonajtak re : ¿ Nen jcholajl tieltakwiˈ mak esbˈitak noˈj ri xabˈij rechak mak cristian ? xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Atak , Kakaj Dios xyaˈ retemaj chawechak jcholajl jtakon ri taˈ etemal . Pero pi rechak mak nicˈj cristian ri taˈ tijcojtak Jyolj Kakaj Dios rajwaxna tambˈij laˈ esbˈitak noˈj rechak ,

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: jwiˈl onque tinaˈtuntakaˈn , pero taˈ tijmajtak jcholajl nen tijin triltak . Tijtaˈtakaˈ nen tibˈijsaj rechak , pero taˈ tijtatak jcholajl nen tijin tijtatak pire maˈ tijqˈuex jnoˈjak y maˈ tikˈajtak chic laj jkˈabˈ Kakaj Dios pire maˈ ticuysaj jmacak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Atak wi mitaˈ tatatak jcholajl nen tielwiˈ man esbˈi noˈj ri , taˈ tatatak jcholajl mak nicˈj esbˈitak noˈj chic .

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: Ri titiquiw mak íjaj , riˈ jun cristian ri tibˈin Jyolj Kakaj Dios rechak cristian .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: Wiˈ jujun jilontak chapcaˈ man bˈe ri lamas xkejtakwiˈ mak íjaj . Tijcˈulaˈtakaˈ Jyolj Kakaj Dios laj ranmak , pero tipe man jbˈabˈal etzl tresaj chic Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri xcˈultak laj ranmak .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: Wiˈ jujun cristian chic jilontak chapcaˈ man ulew lak abˈaj lamas xkejtakwiˈ mak íjaj . Rechak tijtaˈtakaˈ Jyolj Kakaj Dios y tijcˈulaˈtakaˈ pi quiˈcotemal laj ranmak .

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: Pero nicˈ riqˈuil taˈ tibˈe raˈ laj ranmak jwiˈl taˈ tijcubˈaˈ mas jchˈolak chirij . Quibˈ uxibˈ kˈijke tijcojtak , pero cuando titakchiˈjtak chi macunc y cuando tibˈansaj cˈax rechak jwiˈl tijcojtak Jyolj Kakaj Dios laj or tijquibˈaj ranmak .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: Wiˈ jujun cristian chic jilontak chapcaˈ man luwar lak qˈuix ri lamas xkejtakwiˈ mak íjaj , rechak tijtaˈtakaˈ Jyolj Kakaj Dios ,

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: pero riˈ mas tibˈe ranmak chirijak mak kelen re wich ulew y tisubˈsajtak jwiˈl jbˈiomilak y tijrayajtak tiwaˈx subˈlaj kelen rechak . Riˈ li tikˈatow jwich Jyolj Kakaj Dios pire taˈ tiwichin laj ranmak .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Wiˈ jujun cristian chic jilontak chapcaˈ man kuslaj ulew lamas xkejtakwiˈ mak íjaj . Rechak tzˈetel tzˈet tijcojaˈtakaˈ Jyolj Kakaj Dios y tiwaˈxiˈ laj ranmak chapcaˈ kus tiwichin laj ranmak . Jilon chapcaˈ jujun íjaj tijyaˈtakaˈ chapcaˈ junwinak lajuj ( 30 ) jwichak . Jujun chic tijyaˈtakaˈ chapcaˈ oxcˈal ( 60 ) jwichak . Nicˈj chic tijyaˈtakaˈ chapcaˈ jujun cient ( 100 ) jwichak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Taˈ ni jono cristian tijtzij jun candil pire tijyeˈ ralaj jun cax o pire tijyeˈ ralaj jun chˈat . Jun cristian tijtzij jun candil pirechiˈ tijcocbˈaˈ lecj pire tijsakabˈsaj la ja .

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Taˈ ni jono kelen ri tibˈansaj chi mukukil miti tina elna chi sakil .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Nen titonc , jteˈ jcholajl ri tambˈij , xcheˈ rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: Y xij chic rechak : Atak , cojtak retal nen tijin tatatak . Laˈ man pajbˈl ri tacojtak rechak cristian , riˈ ticojsaj chawechak jwiˈl Kakaj Dios y tijyaˈ chiquiˈ mas pi awechak .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Nen wiˈ mas riqˈuil , tiyeˈsaj chiquiˈ mas re y nen taˈ re , asta raquitz ri wiˈ riqˈuil , timajsajiˈ re , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri : Jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian jilon chapcaˈ jun winak ri titiconanc

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: y man winak li onque tiwar o tibˈiitc , chi lakˈj chi lakˈabˈ mak tra íjaj tijin tiel racˈal ricˈanak . Y re taˈ retam nen quiek jwiˈl tijin tiqˈuiy jticoˈn .

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: Tiqˈuiy ticoˈn jwiˈliˈ jchokˈbˈ ulew . Nabˈe tiwaˈx jpatzˈanl , ajrucˈreˈ tiwaˈx rochˈal y tiwaˈx tra bˈakˈ jwich . Cuando ticowin bˈakˈ jwich ,

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: tichekejc y man winak tibˈe chi rochˈic jwiˈl xtawiˈ jkˈijl re tiochˈsajc , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri : ¿ Nen quiek laˈ tiniqˈuibˈsajwiˈ jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian ? ¿ Nen quiek laˈ tikaniqˈuibˈsajwiˈ pire esbˈi noˈj ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian jilon chapcaˈ jun ra íjaj re mostas . Cuando titicsaj lak ulew , riˈ mas ra nuchˈ chijxoˈlak juntir íjaj .

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: Pero cuando tiquilchak mas tiqˈuiyc y mas nim titaw chiwch juntir ichj y mak jkˈabˈ mas nimak titaw asta tzˈiquin tijnaˈ tran jsocak lak jkˈabˈ laj mujal mak xak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: Laˈ esbˈitak noˈj xtijojwiˈ cristian Kakaj Jesús re Jyolj Kakaj Dios pire tijtatak jcholajl .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Taˈ ni jono yoloj xij rechak miti xijna esbˈitak noˈj . Pero cuando ricˈanakchak pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij , ajrucˈreˈ xij jcholajl mak esbˈitak noˈj rechak .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
text2: Laˈ man kˈij li cuando xoc akˈabˈ , Kakaj Jesús xij re yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Joˈtak chˈakap re nimlaj alagun , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xcan jyeˈtak mak cristian y xjawtak li barc lamas wiˈ Kakaj Jesús y xcˈamtakbˈi Kakaj Jesús . Y xeˈ chic nicˈj barc chirijak .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: Xpe jun quiekˈekˈ tew bˈa jaˈ . Xritzˈbˈej man jaˈ y mak retumb re man jaˈ xjawtak li barc . Man barc tichak tijin jnojic chi jaˈ .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús tijin chi waraj chibˈ jun qˈuisbˈi tem li barc y yeˈl jbˈa chibˈ jun chˈiquet jwiˈl . Yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xbˈittak y xchˈejejtak , xijtak re : ¡ Kajtijonl ! Kuske chawe wi xojjikˈ li jaˈ , xcheˈtak re .

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xbˈiitc . Xkˈel tew , xij re jaˈ : ¡ Jun waˈxenwiˈ ! ¡ Mat silibˈ chic ! xcheˈ . Ajrucˈreˈ xkˈax quiekˈekˈ tew y xmay juntir .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij re yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : ¿ Nen chac mas titzaak achˈolak ? ¿ Nen chac taˈ cubˈul achˈolak chwij ? xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: Rechak subˈlaj tzakal jchˈolak chi rilic , xoctak chi jtzˈonaj chiribˈil ribˈak : ¿ Nen chiquiˈ jcholajl winak ri , chi jiˈ quiekˈekˈ tew pach mak retumb re nimlaj alagun ticojontakaˈ chiwch ? xcheˈtak .

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: Kakaj Jesús pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xtawtak chˈakap re nimlaj alagun laj jluwrak yak aj Gadara .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: Cuando xelch Kakaj Jesús li barc , xpe jun winak ri wiˈ etzl laj ranm , relicch li camposant .

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: Man winak li jiˈ jekel li camposant . Taˈ ni jun cristian ticwin chi jximic ni laˈ caden .

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Qˈuilaj bˈwelt xximtak chi rakan y chi jkˈabˈ laˈ caden , pero ticwiniˈ chi jkˈatzic . Taˈ nen ticwin chirij jwiˈl wiˈ mas jchokˈbˈ .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: Man winak li tiwoˈcot chi lakˈj chi lakˈabˈ tichˈejej bˈak witz y li camposant y tran cˈax ribˈ laˈ abˈaj .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Man winak li , cuando xrilch jwich Kakaj Jesús chinaj , tijolin xpetc , xyuk jxucbˈaˈ ribˈ chiwch chi jcojic jkˈij .

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: Man etzl ri wiˈ laj ranm man winak xchˈejejc , xtzˈonaj re Kakaj Jesús : ¿ Nen chawaj chwe Kaj Jesús , at Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios lecj ? ¡ Chiwch Kakaj Dios bˈan tokˈobˈ chwe , min achˈuˈjursaj ! xcheˈ .

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: Man etzl xij jilonli jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús xij re : ¡ At etzl , elambˈi laj ranm winak ri ! xcheˈ .

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj re man etzl : ¿ Nen abˈj ? xcheˈ re . Man etzl xij : Qˈui imbˈj , jwiˈl ojiˈ subˈlaj qˈui woj laj ranm winak , xcheˈ .

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ mak etzl li xtzˈonajtak tokˈobˈ re Kakaj Jesús chi taˈ titaksajtakbˈi chinaj re man luwar li .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: Claˈ wiˈ subˈlaj aak tijin jyukˈicak wich witz .

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: Mak etzl xtzˈonajtak tokˈobˈ re Kakaj Jesús : Cojatakeˈbˈi riqˈuilak mak aak . Yeˈ luwar chike ojoc laj jtioˈjlak , xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xyaˈ luwar rechak . Xeltakbˈi mak etzl laj ranm man winak . Xeˈ octak laj jtioˈjlak mak aak . Raj wiˈ quibˈ mil ( 2 , 000 ) chi aak y mak aak xchˈuˈjartak y xmajtak jol wich witz y xkejtakbˈi pi xulan asta xeˈ tzaaktak li nimlaj alagun , claˈ xjikˈtak .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: Mak ajyukˈultak aak xelmajtak , xeˈtak li tilmit y lak luwar nakaj chi jyolic ri xaanc . Xpetak cristian chi rilic nen xan Kakaj Jesús chi resaj mak etzl laj ranm man winak .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Cuando xtawtak lamas wiˈ Kakaj Jesús xriltak man winak ri xwaˈx mak qˈuitaklaj etzl laj ranm , cubˈulchak , cojolchak ritzˈik jwiˈl y taˈ chiquiˈ chˈuˈj . Rechak xtzaak jchˈolak chi rilic .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Y mak cristian ri xiliwtak nen xan Kakaj Jesús re man winak ri xwaˈx mak etzl laj ranm , xyoltak re mak cristian ri xtawtak claˈ ri nen xan Kakaj Jesús re man winak ri xwaˈx mak etzl laj ranm y ri nen xantak mak aak .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xoctak chi jtzˈonaj subˈlaj tokˈobˈ re Kakaj Jesús chi tielbˈi laj jtilmitak .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús tijin tijaw li barc , man winak ri xesaj mak etzl laj ranm xtzˈonaj subˈlaj tokˈobˈ re Kakaj Jesús chi tibˈe chirij .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús taˈ xyeˈ luwar re man winak xeˈ chirij y xij re : Jat laj awichoch xoˈlak awechˈelxic y yolta rechak juntir ri nen xansaj chawe jwiˈl Awajawl y nen mo xan chi rilic cˈur awch , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús re man winak .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ man winak xecˈ y xoc chi jyolic rechak cristian re Decápolis juntir ri nen xan Kakaj Jesús re y juntir xsaach jchˈolak chi jtaic jyolj .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús xkˈax chicbˈi li barc chˈakap re nimlaj alagun , xtaw subˈlaj cristian riqˈuil chiˈ nimlaj alagun lamas xtawiˈ .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xtaw jun winak ri jbˈij Jairo ri jun rechak mak jbˈabˈalak man kˈat ri tijmulbˈaˈ ribˈak li sinagog . Cuando xril jwich Kakaj Jesús xxucbˈaˈ ribˈ chiwch .

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: Y xtzˈonaj subˈlaj tokˈobˈ re , xij : Inrabˈin camic tran . Bˈan tokˈobˈ , yeˈta akˈbˈ chibˈ pire titzibˈ , xcheˈ re .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xeˈ riqˈuil y subˈlaj cristian xeˈtak chirijak tichak jpitzˈ ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesús .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Y xoˈlak cristian wiˈ jun anm yaj ri wiˈchak cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) junabˈ chi ticar chi cocˈxoˈlke tikej man chˈojnic chirij .

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: Mas cˈax tijil jwiˈl . Poc qˈui ajcun quiek riqˈuil xsachwiˈ juntir jpwaak ri wiˈ , pero taˈ ni jun xcwin chi jcunajc . Masneˈ xnimaˈtan jyaj .

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Cuando xta jtaquil chi Kakaj Jesús ticwiniˈ chi tzibˈsanc , man anm li xjutun chirij Kakaj Jesús xoˈlak cristian y xchap raquitz ritzˈik Kakaj Jesús

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: jwiˈl xchomorsaj laj ranm : Xike wi xincwin chi jchapic raquitz ritzˈik , intzibˈiˈn , xcheˈ .

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Xike cuando xchap raquitz ritzˈik Kakaj Jesús , laj or xtanar man chˈojnic chirij man anm y xricˈajiˈ chi xtzibˈiˈ re jyaj .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xricˈaj chi xtzibˈsajiˈ jun cristian laˈ jcwinel , xsolcopij ribˈ y xtzˈonaj : ¿ Nen xchapow witzˈik ? xcheˈ .

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xtzˈonajtak : ¿ Nen chac tatzˈonaj nen chi cristian lal xchapow awitzˈik ? Juntir cristian atpitzˈowc y atjtucˈtak , xcheˈtak re .

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: Kakaj Jesús tijin tinaˈtun chirij chi rilic nen xchapow ritzˈik .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Man anm tichak querquen jwiˈl jtzakic jchˈol , jwiˈl retamiˈ chi riˈ xchapow re ritzˈik Kakaj Jesús . Xxucbˈaˈ ribˈ chiwch Kakaj Jesús y xij jcholajl re nen quiek jwiˈl xchap ritzˈik .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij re : At inrabˈin , xattzibˈiˈn , jwiˈl xcubˈar achˈol chwij . Jat pi utzil , lajori taˈ chiquiˈ at yaj , xcheˈ re man anm .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Aj tijiniˈ Kakaj Jesús chi yoloj riqˈui man anm li cuando xtawtak nicˈj winak jpeticak laj richoch Jairo ri jbˈabˈalak man kˈat ri tijmulbˈaˈ ribˈak li sinagog y xijtak re : Xcamiˈ arabˈin . Taˈ chiquiˈ nen tichacuj talatzˈabˈsaj jwich sicˈ ajtijonl , xcheˈtak mak winak re Jairo .

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xan chapcaˈ taˈ tijta ri xijtak mak cristian re Jairo y xij re : Mi tzaak achˈol , xike cubˈaˈ achˈol chwij , xcheˈ re .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Taˈ xyeˈ luwar xambˈer mas cristian chirij , xike Pedro , Santiago y Juan ri jkˈun Santiago .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: Y cuando xtawtak laj richoch Jairo xtatak poc tichˈejejtak cristian chi okˈej .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xoc la ja y xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Nen chac poc atchˈejejtak chi okˈej ? Man ra anm taˈ camnak , warajke tran , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Mak cristian xtzeˈjtak jwich Kakaj Jesús cuando xtatak xij chi yoˈliˈ man ra anm . Kakaj Jesús xij rechak cristian chi tieltak la ja , xike xcantak la ja jkaj jchuch man ra anm pach yak ri bˈesaltak chirij . Xoctak lamas wiˈ man ra anm ri xcamc .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xchap chi jkˈabˈ , xij re : ¡ Talita cumi ! xcheˈ re . Ri jcholajl tielwiˈ mak yoloj talita cumi , noy , tambˈij chawe , bˈiiten .

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Man ra anm ri wiˈ cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) junbˈ , laj or xbˈiitc y xoc chi woˈcotem . Juntir xsaach jchˈolak chi rilic .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj tokˈobˈ rechak chi mi jyoltak re cristian ri nen xriltak y xij rechak chi tijyeˈtak jwa man ra anm .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xelbˈi claˈ pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij , xeˈtak laj jtilmit .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Cuando xtaw kˈij re uxlan xoc chi jtijojcak mak cristian li sinagog . Subˈlaj cristian xtatak jyolj Kakaj Jesús y xsaach jchˈolak chi jtaic y xtzˈonajtak chiribˈil ribˈak : ¿ La chiquiˈ mas xretemajwiˈ juntir ri , ri tijin tijbˈij ? ¿ Lacˈumas xpe jnoˈj jilon tran li ? ¿ Nen chiquiˈ mo ticwin chi jbˈanic mak cˈutbˈi jcwinel Kakaj Dios ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Re riˈ man ajcˈox , ri ricˈlal María , ri ratzak Santiago , José , Judas , Simón y yak ranabˈ wiˈtakaˈ neri chikaxoˈl , xcheˈtak . Jwiˈliˈli taˈ rajak tijcojtak lawiˈ ri tijbˈij Kakaj Jesús .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Lak juntir luwar ticojsajiˈ jkˈij jun ajkˈasal Jyolj Kakaj Dios , pero laj jtilmit taˈ ticojsaj jkˈij , ni chijxoˈlak yak rechˈelxic , ni laj richoch , xcheˈ .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: Kakaj Jesús taˈ xnaˈ xan mas cˈutbˈi jcwinel Kakaj Dios claˈ , xike xyeˈ jkˈabˈ laj jbˈaak quibˈ uxibˈ cristian ri yajtak y xtzibˈtak .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xsaach jchˈol chi rilicak mak cristian jwiˈl rechak taˈ xcubˈar jchˈolak chirij . Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xeˈ chi jtijojcak cristian lak luwar ri wiˈtak chi nakaj re Nazaret .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: Kakaj Jesús xmulbˈaˈ yak cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) ajtijol ribˈak chirij y ajrucˈreˈ xchol jtakicak pi cacabˈ ribˈilak , xyeˈ cwinel rechak chi resaj mak etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak cristian .

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Xij rechak chi taˈ nen tijcˈamtakbˈi pire laj jbˈeak xike jujun jcarotak . Taˈ tijcˈamtakbˈi jwaak , ni jchimak , ni jpwaakak .

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Xike tijcˈamtakbˈi jxajbˈak ri cojol jwiˈlak y mi jcˈamtakbˈi jun túnica chic .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Cuando atoctak li jun tilmit y wi tataˈtak aposadak li jun ja , waˈxentak claˈ asta titaw kˈij ateltakbˈi li man tilmit li .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Y wi yak cristian li jono tilmit taˈ atjcˈultak y taˈ rajak tijtatak ayoljak , elantakbˈi claˈ . Can totojtak man pok laˈ awakanak pire cˈutbˈire chiwchak chi taˈ tzi xantak jwiˈl taˈ xatjcˈultak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesucristo xeltakbˈi chi jtijoj cristian y xijtak rechak chi rajwaxiˈ tijqˈuex jnoˈjak ,

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: xresajtak subˈlaj etzl ri wiˈ laj ranmak cristian y subˈlaj cristian yajtak xcojtak aceit laj jbˈaak y xtzibˈsajtak .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Man rey Herodes Antipas xta jtaquil nen tijin tran Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl wiˈchak jtaquil lak juntir tilmit . Jujun cristian xijtak : Riˈ Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox ri xcˈastasaj jwich laj jcamnakl xoˈlak camnakibˈ , jwiˈliˈli ticwin chi jbˈanic cˈutbˈi jcwinel Kakaj Dios , xcheˈtak .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Nicˈj cristian chic xijtak : Riˈ Elías , xcheˈtak . Nicˈj chic xijtak : Riˈ jun ajkˈasal Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri nicˈ chapcaˈ yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios ojrtaktzij , xcheˈtak .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Cuando Herodes Antipas xta jtaquil ri tijin tran Kakaj Jesús , xij : Li riˈ Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox ri xintak resaj jbˈa . Lajori xcˈastasajiˈ jwich laj jcamnakl , xcheˈ .

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: Jilonli xij Herodes Antipas jwiˈl riˈ re xtakow jchapic Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox y xtakow jximic laˈ caden li cars jwiˈl Herodías ri xwaˈx pi rixokl Herodes Felipe ri jkˈun Herodes Antipas . Herodes Antipas xcˈuliˈy riqˈui man anm li .

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Jwiˈliˈli Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox xij re Herodes Antipas : Taˈ tzi xabˈan xatcˈuliˈy riqˈui rixokl akˈun , xcheˈ re .

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: Jwiˈliˈli Herodías xcontrij Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox . Jwiˈl retzal raj roj xcamsaj , pero taˈ xnaˈw .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: Jwiˈl Herodes Antipas retamiˈ chi tzilaj winakiˈ Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox y sucˈuliˈ ranm chiwch Kakaj Dios , xtzaak jchˈol chi jcamsajc . Jilonli taˈ xyeˈ luwar xansaj cˈax re . Herodes Antipas taˈ kes xta jcholajl nen xij Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox , pero nojeliˈ ranm xta jyolj .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Pero xtawna jun kˈij chiwch Herodías xcamsaj Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox y riˈ cuando Herodes xcˈul jkˈij . Xpe Herodes , xsiqˈuij mak ri wiˈ rekleˈnak pi jpach , mak jbˈabˈalak mak soldad y mak winak ri cojol jkˈijak ri wiˈtak Galilea , xantak jun comon wicˈ .

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Xpe man kˈapoj anm ri ricˈlal Herodías , xoc la ja lamas tijintak chi wicˈ y xoc chi xojoj chiwchak . Y Herodes Antipas pach mak winak ri tijintak chi wicˈ riqˈuil bˈa mex jor kus xriltak xojow man kˈapoj anm . Ajrucˈreˈ man rey Herodes xij re man kˈapoj anm : Tzˈonaj chwe nen chawaj . In tanyaˈ chawe , xcheˈ re .

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: Xsuj chi kes tzˈet tijyaˈ nen chi kelen lal titzˈonaj re asta pajnicˈj re juntir ri titakon chibˈ tijyaˈ re .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Man kˈapoj anm xelbˈi xeˈ jtzˈonaj re jchuch : ¿ Nen tantzˈonaj ? xcheˈ re jchuch . Jchuch xij re : Tzˈonaj jbˈa Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox , xcheˈ re .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Man kˈapoj anm xoc laj or lamas wiˈ man rey Herodes , xij re : Chwaj chi tayeˈ chwe li jun nimlaj plat jbˈa Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox , xcheˈ re .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ man rey Herodes jorchak tibˈisonc , pero jwiˈl xijiˈ chi kes tzˈet tijyaˈ nen titzˈonaj re y jwiˈl xtasajiˈ jwiˈl mak winak ri siqˈuil jwiˈl , taˈ xnaˈw xij chi taˈ chiquiˈ tijyeˈ ri xtzˈonaj re jwiˈl man kˈapoj anm .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Laj or xtakbˈi jun soldad pire tibˈe jcˈameˈch jbˈa Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox li jun nimlaj plat . Man soldad li xeˈ resajch jbˈa Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox li cars

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: y xyeˈch li jun nimlaj plat , xcˈamch . Xyeˈ re man kˈapoj anm y man kˈapoj anm xeˈ jyeˈ re jchuch .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Cuando yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox xtatak jtaquil ri xansaj re , xeˈ jcˈameˈtakch jcamnakl y xmuktak .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Yak jtakoˈn Kakaj Jesús ri xkˈajtakch chi jbˈij Jyolj Kakaj Dios xmulbˈaˈ ribˈak riqˈui Kakaj Jesús y xyoltak re nen bˈanal jwiˈlak y nen xantak chi jtijoj cristian re Jyolj Kakaj Dios .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Jwiˈl subˈlaj cristian tibˈetak y tipetak riqˈuilak , taˈ tijnaˈ tiwiˈntak . Jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Tzajtak , coj uxlantak junquitz li jun luwar kicˈan , xcheˈ .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ rechak xeˈtak ricˈanak li jun barc li jun luwar lamas taˈ cristian chˈakap re nimlaj alagun .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Subˈlaj qˈui cristian xiliwtak re Kakaj Jesús pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij bˈesaltak li barc bˈa jaˈ . Xeltakch jol chi rakanak lak juntir tilmit xeˈ jcˈuleˈtak y nabˈe xtawtak chiˈ nimlaj alagun chiwchak Kakaj Jesús pach yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús xelbˈi li barc xril subˈlaj qˈui cristian mulantak claˈ , xril cˈur jwichak jwiˈl jilontak chapcaˈ jun kˈat carner ri taˈ ajyukˈ rechak . Xoc chi jtijojcak re subˈlaj kelen chirij Jyolj Kakaj Dios .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Cuando xeˈ kˈij yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij Kakaj Jesucristo , xjutuntak chijcˈulel y xijtak re : Xiˈ kˈij y laˈ man luwar ri taˈ cristian .

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Qˈuis ayolj riqˈuilak cristian y bˈij rechak chi tibˈe jlokˈeˈ jwaak li mak tilmit y li mak ja ri wiˈtak chi nakaj , xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Yeˈtak jwaak atak , xcheˈ . Rechak xijtak : Tichoconiˈ quibˈ cient chi denario pire tikalokˈ cuxlanwa pire tikatzuktak juntir ribˈilak , xcheˈtak re Kakaj Jesús .

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Iltaknecaˈ , ¿ jurubˈ chi cuxlanwa wiˈ aacˈlak ? xcheˈ rechak . Cuando xriltak , xijtak re Kakaj Jesús : Jobˈ chi cuxlanwa pach quibˈ chi car , xcheˈtak .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xij re yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij chi tijbˈijtak re cristian chi ticubˈartak bˈak qˈuim y tijcˈam ribˈak pitak mulaj .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Mak cristian xcubˈartak . Xcˈam ribˈak pitak jujun cient ( 100 ) y pitak caˈwinak lajuj ( 50 ) ribˈilak .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Kakaj Jesús xcˈam mak jobˈ cuxlanwa laj jkˈabˈ pach mak quibˈ car y xnaˈtun lecj . Xcˈomowaj re Kakaj Dios , xqˈuer mak cuxlanwa y xyeˈ rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij pire tijjachtak re juntir cristian . Y xyeˈ mak quibˈ car rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij pire xjachtak rechak cristian .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Juntir cristian xwiˈntak asta xnojtak .

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: Cuando xcolajtak juntir cristian , xnojsajtakna cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) chicach chi qˈuertak cuxlanwa pach car ri taˈ xqˈuisc .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Jobˈ miltakaˈ ( 5 , 000 ) chi winak ri xwiˈntak .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Cuando xantaj li jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , xij rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij chi tijawtakbˈi li barc y tinabˈertakbˈi pire tikˈaxtakbˈi nabˈe chˈakap re nimlaj alagun pire tibˈetak Betsaida . Re xcanna jchˈabˈejna mak cristian .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xjaw bˈa jun witz chi chˈaˈwem riqˈui Kakaj Dios .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Cuando xoc akˈabˈ , man barc bˈesalchak laj jnicˈajl man jaˈ . Kakaj Jesús xcan ricˈanchak chiˈ nimlaj alagun .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Re xrilbˈi chi mas usil jbˈic man barc jwiˈl man tew jiˈ tijin jpetic laj jsucˈlal lamas bˈesal man barc . Cuando sakaremchak re , xeˈ chi rilicak , bˈe tran bˈa nimlaj alagun xjutumbˈi riqˈuilak . Xan chapcaˈ kˈaxem trambˈi chiwchak .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Cuando yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xriltak chi bˈe tran Kakaj Jesús bˈesal bˈa nimlaj alagun , chijchˈolak rechak ajtzakal chˈoliˈn y xchˈejejtak .

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Juntir xiliwtak y subˈlaj xtzaak jchˈolak , pero Kakaj Jesús laj or xchˈabˈejtakbˈic , xijbˈi rechak : Cowirsaj awanmak , iniˈn , mi tzaak achˈolak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And he went up unto them into the ship ; and the wind ceased : and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure , and wondered .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xjaw li barc riqˈuilak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij y xtanar man quiekˈekˈ tew . Xsaach jchˈolak

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: jwiˈl ajquiˈ chi retemajtak nen tijin tran Kakaj Jesús , jwiˈl mas usil tijin tretemajtak onque xrilaˈtakaˈ nen xan Kakaj Jesús chi jtzukic qˈuilaj cristian laˈke quibˈ uxibˈ chi cuxlanwa .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: Cuando xkˈaxtakbˈi chˈakap re nimlaj alagun , xtawtak li jun luwar ri jbˈij Genesaret y claˈ ximtakwiˈ man barc chiˈ jaˈ .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: Xike cuando xkejtakch , mak cristian laj or xchˈobˈtak jwich Kakaj Jesús .

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: Jilonli xeˈtak jol lak juntir luwar re Genesaret , xeˈ jcˈameˈtakch bˈak chˈatum cheˈ yak ri yajtak . Xcˈamtakbˈi riqˈui Kakaj Jesús .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
