text: And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful and wise steward , whom his lord shall make ruler over his household , to give them their portion of meat in due season ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl xij : Jun mocom ri tzi tran laj jchac y tzi jnoˈj ticojsajiˈ pire jbˈabˈalak mak nicˈj mocom chic jwiˈl jpatron y riˈ re titzukuw rechak lak or re wicˈ .

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Tzi re man mocom li , ri tiyuk taˈsajok jwiˈl jpatron tijin chi jbˈanic chapcaˈ xcan bˈijsaj re .

text: Of a truth I say unto you , that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
text2: Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak chi man patron tijcojaˈ man mocom li chi jchajaj juntir kelen re ri wiˈ .

text: But and if that servant say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens , and to eat and drink , and to be drunken ;
text2: Pero wi man mocom li tijbˈij laj ranm chi taˈ tikˈajch jpatron laj or , tioc chi jseqˈuicak yak nicˈj mocom chic pach mak ajicˈ , tioc chi wicˈ , tioc chi ucˈaˈjanc y tioc chi kˈabˈric .

text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him , and at an hour when he is not aware , and will cut him in sunder , and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers .
text2: Titaw jun kˈij y titaw jun or ri taˈ ricˈabˈ cuando tiyuk jpatron . Man patron li tijyeˈ jun cˈaxlaj cˈachbˈi wich re man jmocom li , tresaj chi jchajaj kelen re , tijtak chijxoˈlak mak ri taˈ ticojontak .

text: And that servant , which knew his lord ' s will , and prepared not himself , neither did according to his will , shall be beaten with many stripes .
text2: Man mocom ri retam nen raj jpatron tran y taˈ raj tran , tisecˈsajiˈ jwiˈl jpatron pire cˈachbˈi jwich jwiˈl taˈ tzi tran .

text: But he that knew not , and did commit things worthy of stripes , shall be beaten with few stripes . For unto whomsoever much is given , of him shall be much required : and to whom men have committed much , of him they will ask the more .
text2: Man mocom ri taˈ retam nen raj jpatron tran y tran kelen ri taˈ tzi tiilsajwiˈ jwiˈl jpatron , tisecˈsajiˈ pire cˈachbˈi jwich , pero taˈ mas . Nen nim tiyeˈsaj re , masna nim titzˈonaj re . Nen wiˈ mas rekleˈn , masna nim ri rajwax tran , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: I am come to send fire on the earth ; and what will I if it be already kindled ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak : In ximpe chi jcojic kˈakˈ neri wich ulew . Y in riˈ chwaj chi tichak tijin jcˈatic man kˈakˈ li .

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with ; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished !
text2: Y rajwaxiˈ tina intijna jun nimlaj cˈax y subˈlaj cˈax tantij asta titaw man kˈij li .

text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth ? I tell you , Nay ; but rather division :
text2: Ma bˈij atak chi inwiˈlke in tiwaˈx utzil chijxoˈlak cristian . Jwiˈl inwiˈlke in tijtos ribˈak yak cristian .

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided , three against two , and two against three .
text2: Lajori ticholmajbˈic , wi wiˈ jobˈ cristian li jun ja , tijcontrijiˈ ribˈak , uxibˈ tijcontrijtak mak quibˈ y mak quibˈ tijcontrijtak mak uxibˈ .

text: The father shall be divided against the son , and the son against the father ; the mother against the daughter , and the daughter against the mother ; the mother in law against her daughter in law , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Jun winak tijcontrij jcˈajol y re ticontrij jwiˈl jcˈajol . Jun kˈapoj anm tijcontrij jchuch y jun albˈ tijcontrij man alibˈxel y man alibˈxel tijcontrij ralbˈ , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he said also to the people , When ye see a cloud rise out of the west , straightway ye say , There cometh a shower ; and so it is .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak subˈlaj qˈui cristian : Cuando tawiltak tipe sutzˈ laj jsucˈlal lamas tikej kˈij , atak tabˈijtak chi tipetiˈ jabˈ y tzˈetiˈ tipe jabˈ .

text: And when ye see the south wind blow , ye say , There will be heat ; and it cometh to pass .
text2: Y cuando tatatak tijubˈubˈ tew li sur tabˈijtak chi tieliˈ sakˈj y tzˈetiˈ tiel sakˈj .

text: Ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth ; but how is it that ye do not discern this time ?
text2: Atak ajsolcopil acaybˈalak , atak awetamakiˈ rilic nen tran caj pach ulew , pero taˈ tachˈobˈtak chirij mak ri tijin tawiltak laˈ mak junabˈ lajori , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Yea , and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Nen chac maˈ tachomorsajtak pi awicˈanak lawiˈ tzi y lawiˈ ri taˈ tzi ?

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate , as thou art in the way , give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him ; lest he hale thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and the officer cast thee into prison .
text2: Wi wiˈ nen atsiqˈuin li kˈatbˈitzij , jat riqˈuil , chomorsaj aybˈak pi utzil riqˈuil laj or cuando bˈesalcatak li bˈe pire taˈ chiquiˈ atbˈe jacheˈ laj jkˈabˈ man kˈatbˈitzij , jwiˈl wi atjjach laj jkˈabˈ man kˈatbˈitzij , tipe man kˈatbˈitzij atjjach laj jkˈabˈak mak mayor y rechak atjcojtak li cars .

text: I tell thee , thou shalt not depart thence , till thou hast paid the very last mite .
text2: Tambˈij chawe chi wi xatkej li cars , taˈ atelbˈi wi mitaˈ tatoj man qˈuisbˈi centaw pire atesajbˈic , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans , whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices .
text2: Laˈ mak kˈij li , xtawtak nicˈj cristian chi rilic Kakaj Jesús y xijtak re nen mo xansaj rechak nicˈj cristian aj Galilea ri xcamsajtak jwiˈl Pilato cuando tijin tijsujtak awaj re Kakaj Dios .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans , because they suffered such things ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj rechak : ¿ Riˈcˈu chachˈol atak xcamsajtak yak cristian aj Galilea jwiˈl wiˈ mas jmacak chiwchak yak cristian laj jtilmitak ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Maˈ jiˈtaˈlonli jcholajl . Y jilon atak wi mitaˈ taqˈuex anoˈjak y taˈ tacˈam jkˈabˈal amacak chiwch Kakaj Dios , tibˈansajiˈ kˈatbˈitzij chabˈak chapcaˈ xansaj re yak cristian li .

text: Or those eighteen , upon whom the tower in Siloam fell , and slew them , think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem ?
text2: ¿ O riˈcˈu chachˈol atak chi mak waxaklajuj ( 18 ) cristian ri xcamtak cuando xtzaakch man tzˈaak ri naj rakˈanebˈ chibˈak ri wiˈ Siloé , jwiˈliˈ wiˈ mas jmacak chiwchak juntir cristian ri wiˈtak Jerusalén ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Maˈ jiˈtaˈlonli jcholajl . Pero wi atak taˈ taqˈuex anoˈjak y taˈ tacˈam jkˈabˈal amacak chiwch Kakaj Dios , jilon cˈax tatijtak chapcaˈ xtijtak yak cristian li , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: He spake also this parable ; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard ; and he came and sought fruit thereon , and found none .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xoc chi jbˈij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak cristian jilonri : Wiˈ jun winak tiquil jun jcheˈl higo jwiˈl laj rulew . Jun kˈij xeˈ rileˈ wi wiˈchak jwich , pero taˈ xtaˈ ni jun jwich .

text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard , Behold , these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree , and find none : cut it down ; why cumbereth it the ground ?
text2: Jwiˈliˈli xpe man rajw ulew li , xij re man jmocom ri tiakˈinan re mak jticoˈn : Xiˈ uxibˈ junabˈ , nojel junabˈ tiyuk wileˈ man jcheˈl higo wi wiˈ jwich , pero ni jun bˈwelt xintaˈ jwich . Lajori tacˈurbˈic , pire maˈ tran latzˈ , xcheˈ .

text: And he answering said unto him , Lord , let it alone this year also , till I shall dig about it , and dung it :
text2: Pero man mocom xij re rajw man ulew : Kaj , waˈxna claˈ , re man junabˈ ri tzi jcˈupic rij tambˈan y tanyeˈ abono laj raˈ .

text: And if it bear fruit , well : and if not , then after that thou shalt cut it down .
text2: Y wi tiwichin laˈ man junabˈ ri , waˈxna claˈ y wi mitaˈ tiwichinc , ajrucˈreˈ tacˈurbˈic , xcheˈ man mocom re man rajw ulew , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath .
text2: Li jun kˈij re uxlan , cuando tijin Kakaj Jesús chi jtijojcak cristian re Jyolj Kakaj Dios li jun sinagog

text: And , behold , there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years , and was bowed together , and could in no wise lift up herself .
text2: y claˈ wiˈ jun sicˈ anm chijxoˈlak cristian , wiˈchak waxaklajuj ( 18 ) junabˈ yaj jwiˈl jun etzl , tˈustˈic rij tibˈen y taˈ tijnaˈ tiwaˈr pi sucˈulc .

text: And when Jesus saw her , he called her to him , and said unto her , Woman , thou art loosed from thine infirmity .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xril sicˈ anm li , xsiqˈuij y xij re : At anm , lajori xatcolmajiˈ riqˈui ayaj , xcheˈ re .

text: And he laid his hands on her : and immediately she was made straight , and glorified God .
text2: Y xyeˈ jkˈabˈ laj jbˈa sicˈ anm y sicˈ anm laj or xtzibˈc , xsucˈulabˈ rij y xoc chi jbˈixaj jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios .

text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation , because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day , and said unto the people , There are six days in which men ought to work : in them therefore come and be healed , and not on the sabbath day .
text2: Pero man jbˈabˈal man kˈat ri tijmulbˈaˈ ribˈak li sinagog claˈ , subˈlaj xpe retzal chirij Kakaj Jesús jwiˈl xtzibˈsaj sicˈ anm laˈ kˈij re uxlan . Jwiˈliˈli xij rechak juntir cristian : Laˈ nojel xuman wiˈ wakakibˈ ( 6 ) kˈij pire chac . Y laˈ mak kˈij li petentak pire attzibˈsajtak , maˈ ajriˈ taˈ atpetak laˈ mak kˈij re uxlan , xcheˈ rechak cristian .

text: The Lord then answered him , and said , Thou hypocrite , doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall , and lead him away to watering ?
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl xij rechak : Atak , atake ajsolcopil acaybˈalak , ¿ taˈcˈu ni jono chawechak maˈ tijquirbˈi jbˈur o jwacx laj richoch awaj pire tibˈe jyeˈ rucˈaˈ laˈ kˈij re uxlan ?

text: And ought not this woman , being a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan hath bound , lo , these eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day ?
text2: Y anm ri , rijajliˈ Abraham y xanaˈ waxaklajuj ( 18 ) junabˈ jximic jwiˈl man etzl laˈ man yajel ri , ¿ taˈcˈu tijnaˈ titzibˈsaj re jyaj laˈ kˈij re uxlan ? xcheˈ rechak .

text: And when he had said these things , all his adversaries were ashamed : and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him .
text2: Cuando xij jilonli Kakaj Jesús rechak , juntir mak ri xcontrin re , xqˈuixibˈtak chiwch . Pero yak nicˈj cristian chic subˈlaj xquiˈcot ranmak jwiˈl xriltak chi Kakaj Jesús tran nimaktak kelen ri sachom chˈolal rilic .

text: Then said he , Unto what is the kingdom of God like ? and whereunto shall I resemble it ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij : ¿ Nen quiek laˈ tiniqˈuibˈsajwiˈ jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian ? ¿ Nen quiek laˈ tanniqˈuibˈsajwiˈ ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and cast into his garden ; and it grew , and waxed a great tree ; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it .
text2: In tambˈij chawechak chi niqˈuiˈ chapcaˈ jun ra íjaj re mostas ri tijtic jun winak laj rulew . Cuando tiqˈuiyc , subˈlaj nim titaw chapcaˈ rilic jun cheˈ y mak tzˈiquin tran jsocak lak jkˈabˈ , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And again he said , Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic : ¿ Nen quiek laˈ tanniqˈuibˈsajwiˈ jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian ?

text: It is like leaven , which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Niqˈuiˈ chapcaˈ chˈamkˈor ri tijcˈam jun anm , tijyuj pach uxibˈ pajbˈl chi cˈaj pire tijchˈamabˈsaj juntir man kˈor , xcheˈ .

text: And he went through the cities and villages , teaching , and journeying toward Jerusalem .
text2: Kakaj Jesús bˈesalc , bˈenam re Jerusalén , pi kˈaxem tran , xkˈax lak jujun tilmit y lak jujun luwar chi jtijoj cristian re Jyolj Kakaj Dios .

text: Then said one unto him , Lord , are there few that be saved ? And he said unto them ,
text2: Xpe jun rechak , xtzˈonaj re Kakaj Jesús : Kajawl , ¿ quibˈ uxibˈinke cristian ticolmajtak laj jkˈabˈ mac ? xcheˈ re . Kakaj Jesús xij re :

text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate : for many , I say unto you , will seek to enter in , and shall not be able .
text2: Coj jcowil awanmak chi oquem laˈ man pwert nuchˈ jwich , jwiˈl subˈlaj cristian rajak tioctak laˈ , pero taˈ ticwintak .

text: When once the master of the house is risen up , and hath shut to the door , and ye begin to stand without , and to knock at the door , saying , Lord , Lord , open unto us ; and he shall answer and say unto you , I know you not whence ye are :
text2: Cuando man rajw ja tibˈiitc y tijtzˈapij man pwert , atak ri watak rij ja , atoctak chi jcˈoscˈoj man pwert y tabˈijtak : Kaj , tebˈaˈcojoˈ man pwert chikawch , atcheˈtak . Pero re tijbˈij chawechak : Taˈ tanchˈobˈ awchak y taˈ wetam lamas atpetak , ticheˈ chawechak .

text: Then shall ye begin to say , We have eaten and drunk in thy presence , and thou hast taught in our streets .
text2: Y atak tabˈijtak chic re : Ojiˈ ri xojwiˈn y xojucˈaˈjanc aacˈl y lak bˈe re katilmit xkatijojiˈ cristian re Jyolj Kakaj Dios , atcheˈtak re .

text: But he shall say , I tell you , I know you not whence ye are ; depart from me , all ye workers of iniquity .
text2: Pero re tijbˈij chawechak : Tijin tambˈij chawechak chi taˈ tanchˈobˈ awchak y taˈ wetam lamas atpetak . ¡ Elantakbˈic , atak juntir atakaˈ ajbˈanaltak etzltak noˈj ! ticheˈ chawechak .

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth , when ye shall see Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , and all the prophets , in the kingdom of God , and you yourselves thrust out .
text2: Claˈ tibˈe awokˈbˈej aybˈak y takuchˈuchˈuj aweeak cuando tawiltak Abraham , Isaac , Jacob y juntir yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios wiˈtak li man luwar lamas titakon Kakaj Dios y atak xatcan esajtak .

text: And they shall come from the east , and from the west , and from the north , and from the south , and shall sit down in the kingdom of God .
text2: Laˈ mak kˈij li tipetakaˈ mas cristian , wiˈ tipetak laj jsucˈlal lamas tielch kˈij y wiˈ tipetak laj jsucˈlal lamas tikej kˈij y wiˈ tipetak li norte y wiˈ tipetak li sur . Juntir rechak tibˈe waˈxtak li man luwar lamas titakon Kakaj Dios chapcaˈ ticubˈartak chiˈ mex chi wicˈ .

text: And , behold , there are last which shall be first , and there are first which shall be last .
text2: Jwiˈliˈli wiˈ jujun rechak ri qˈuisbˈire lajori jwiˈl taˈ cojol jkˈijak , riˈtakaˈ tinabˈertak jwiˈl tina cojsajna jkˈijak y wiˈ jujun rechak ri nabˈetak lajori jwiˈl nim jkˈijak , riˈtakaˈ ticantak pi qˈuisbˈire jwiˈl taˈ chiquiˈ ticojsaj jkˈijak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak cristian .

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees , saying unto him , Get thee out , and depart hence : for Herod will kill thee .
text2: Laj or xtawtak nicˈj fariseo riqˈui Kakaj Jesús y xijtak re : Elambˈi neri , Herodes Antipas raj atjcamsaj , xcheˈtak re .

text: And he said unto them , Go ye , and tell that fox , Behold , I cast out devils , and I do cures to day and to morrow , and the third day I shall be perfected .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Jattak riqˈui man utiwlaj kˈatbˈitzij y bˈijtatak re : In tina wesajna mak etzl laj ranmak yak cristian y tina intzibˈsajtakna yak cristian ri yajtak lajori , chwekˈ y cabˈij tanqˈuis jbˈanic juntir inchc , ticheˈ , atcheˈtak re .

text: Nevertheless I must walk to day , and to morrow , and the day following : for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem .
text2: Pero lajori rajwaxiˈ tina intakejna jbˈanic lawiˈ ri rajwax tambˈan , chwekˈ y cabˈij , jwiˈl taˈ ni jono yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios ticam li jun jalan luwar , rajwaxiˈ jiˈ ticam Jerusalén , xcheˈ .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , which killest the prophets , and stonest them that are sent unto thee ; how often would I have gathered thy children together , as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: Y xij chic chirijak mak cristian ri wiˈtak Jerusalén : ¡ Atak aj Jerusalén , atak aj Jerusalén , ri tacamsajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios y tasecˈtak chi abˈaj yak jtakoˈn Kakaj Dios ri takaltakch aacˈlak ! ¡ Qˈuilaj bˈwelt roj chwaj xinmulbˈaˈ awchak chapcaˈ tran jun chuch acˈ tijmulbˈaˈ tra jkˈun ralaj jxicˈ , pero atak taˈ chawajak !

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate : and verily I say unto you , Ye shall not see me , until the time come when ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Tatak jcholajl , awichochak tina canna pi caneˈl ja . Y tambˈij chawechak chi lajori taˈ chiquiˈ tawiltak inwch , ajriˈ tawiltak chic inwch cuando tabˈijtak jilonri : ¡ Nim jkˈij ri petzal laj jbˈij Kakaj Dios ri Kajawl ! atcheˈtak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And it came to pass , as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day , that they watched him .
text2: Li jun kˈij re uxlan Kakaj Jesús xeˈ chi wicˈ laj richoch jun rechak mak jbˈabˈalak mak fariseo . Claˈ wiˈ chiquiˈ nicˈj fariseo xmukcheˈjtake nen tran Kakaj Jesús .

text: And , behold , there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy .
text2: Claˈ wiˈ jun winak yaj , subˈlaj sipoˈl .

text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xtzˈonaj rechak yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios y rechak mak fariseo ri wiˈtak la ja claˈ : ¿ Ton jnaˈ titzibˈsaj jun cristian laˈ kˈij re uxlan o taˈn ? xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they held their peace . And he took him , and healed him , and let him go ;
text2: Pero rechak taˈ xchˈaˈwtak . Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xchap sicˈ winak ri yaj , xtzibˈsaj y xij re chi tibˈec .

text: And answered them , saying , Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit , and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day ?
text2: Y Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak : Wi wiˈ jono chawechak titzaakbˈi jcˈajol o jwacx li jun jul laˈ kˈij re uxlan , ¿ taˈcˈu atbˈetak jol chi resajc ? xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they could not answer him again to these things .
text2: Yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios pach mak fariseo taˈ xtaˈtak nen mo jcˈululaj jyolj Kakaj Jesús xantak .

text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden , when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms ; saying unto them ,
text2: Kakaj Jesús cuando xril chi mak ri siqˈuiltak chi wicˈ , xchaˈtak mak tem ri lamas ticubˈartak yak ri wiˈ rekleˈnak , xij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri :

text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: Cuando wiˈ jono cristian tibˈin chawe chi atbˈe riqˈuil li nimakˈij re jun tzˈam , wi nabˈe attaw , mat cubˈar laˈ man tem lamas ticubˈartak yak ri wiˈ rekleˈnak . Jwiˈl wi cubˈulcatchak claˈ cuando titaw jun mas nim jkˈij chic chawch at ,

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: tipe man rajw ja ri xin chawe chi atbˈe riqˈuil pach man ajriˈ xtaw , tijbˈij chawe : Bˈan tokˈobˈ , elan claˈ , can yeˈ man tem pire winak ri , ticheˈ chawe . Y at , atchak qˈuixibˈc , atbˈe cubˈar chic laˈ man qˈuisbˈi tem .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Y jwiˈliˈli wi tibˈijsaj chawe chi atbˈe li nimakˈij re jun tzˈam , cubˈren laˈ man qˈuisbˈi tem . Jilonli cuando atilsaj jwiˈl man ri xin chawe chi atbˈe li nimakˈij riqˈuil tipe aacˈl y tijbˈij chawe : At wichcˈulchiˈ , cubˈren laˈ man tem ri lamas ticubˈartak yak ri wiˈ rekleˈnak , ticheˈ chawe . Y cuando tibˈansaj jilonli chawe , tinimirsajiˈ akˈij chiwchak juntir mak cristian ri wiˈtak claˈ .

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Jwiˈl nen tijcoj jkˈij ricˈan , taˈ ticojsaj jkˈij y nen taˈ tijcoj jkˈij , riˈ li ticojsaj jkˈij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic re man winak ri xin re chi tibˈe wiˈnok riqˈuil : At , cuando tabˈan jono comon wicˈ laj awichoch y tabˈij re cristian pire tiyuk wiˈntak aacˈl , ma bˈij re yak awichcˈulchiˈ , yak akˈun awatz , yak awechˈelxic y yak acˈulja ri bˈiomtak , jwiˈl rechak atjsiqˈuij chiquiˈ at chi jtijic wa riqˈuilak cuando trantak comon wicˈ . Jilonli trantak chic chi jyeˈic jqˈuixel chawe ri xayeˈ rechak .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Pero at , cuando tabˈan jono comon wicˈ laj awichoch y wi tabˈij re cristian chi tipetak chi wicˈ aacˈl , bˈij re yak ri wiˈ rajwax rechak , yak ri taˈ tzˈakat rakan jkˈabˈak , yak coˈx y yak moy .

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: Y jilonli subˈlaj tzi awe , jwiˈl rechak taˈ ticwintak chi jyeˈic jqˈuixel chawe ri tayeˈ rechak . Ajriˈ tiyeˈsaj jqˈuixel chawe cuando ticˈastasaj awch laj acamnakl pach yak cristian ri sucˈul ranmak chiwch Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús re .

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: Y wiˈ jun winak cubˈul claˈ , cuando xta nen xij Kakaj Jesús , re xij : Tzi re jun cristian ri tiwiˈn li man luwar lamas titakonwiˈ Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ re .

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij : Wiˈ jun winak xan comon wicˈ laj richoch y raj roj xtzukeˈ subˈlaj cristian , jwiˈliˈli xij rechak chi titawtak riqˈuil la ja .

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: Cuando xtaw or trantak man comon wicˈ , xpe man winak xtak jun jtakoˈn chi jsiqˈuij mak cristian ri quiek re xijwiˈ chi titawtak laj richoch chi wicˈ y man takoˈn xecˈ , xeˈ jbˈij rechak : Joˈtak , tijtatak wa laj richoch impatron , wa xantajiˈn , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Pero juntir xoctak chi jtzˈonaj jcuybˈi jmacak . Wiˈ jun xij : Cuy immac , taˈ imbˈantaj imbˈec , jwiˈl wiˈ jun ulew ajriˈ xinlokˈ y rajwaxiˈ imbˈe chi rilic , xcheˈ .

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Y jun chic xij : Cuy immac , taˈ imbˈantaj imbˈec , jwiˈl wiˈ jobˈ yunt inwacx ajriˈ xinlokˈ y lajori rajwaxiˈ tibˈe incojeˈtak li chac pire twil nen mo tichacuntak , xcheˈ .

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: Y jun chic xij : Taˈ tijnaˈ imbˈec , jwiˈl ajriˈ xkacˈam kibˈ pach wixokl , xcheˈ .

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: Cuando xkˈajch man takoˈn ri xtaksajbˈi chi jsiqˈuijcak , xyuk jbˈij re jpatron juntir nen ri xijsajch re . Man jpatron subˈlaj xpe retzal chi jtaic y xij chic re man jtakoˈn : Lajori jat lak bˈe y li cˈaybˈl re tilmit , toctach juntir yak ri wiˈ rajwax rechak , yak ri taˈ tzˈakat rakan jkˈabˈak , yak moy y yak coˈx , xcheˈ re man jtakoˈn .

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: Y cuando xkˈajch man jtakoˈn , xij : Kaj , xincˈamaˈch yak cristian ri xabˈij chwe , pero ajwiˈ mas tem , xcheˈ re man jpatron .

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: Y man jpatron xij chic re : Lajori jat lak nimaktak bˈe y lak kˈuntak bˈe , bˈijta rechak juntir yak cristian ri wiˈtak xoˈlak bˈe chi tipetak laj wichoch , in riˈ chwaj tinoj wichoch chi cristian ,

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: jwiˈl kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chi ni jono rechak yak ri siqˈuiltak inwiˈl nabˈe , tipetak chi wicˈ laj wichoch , xcheˈ man patron , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: Subˈlaj cristian bˈesaltak chirij Kakaj Jesús y re xsolcopij ribˈ chi rilicak y xij rechak :

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Wi wiˈ jono ri xam chwij raj tioc pire ajtijol ribˈ chwij , pero wi masna tijlokˈaj jkaj jchuch , rixokl , ralcˈwal y rechˈelxic o masna tijlokˈaj jcˈaslemal chinwch in , taˈ tzi tioc pire ajtijol ribˈ chwij .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: Y nen taˈ raj tijtij cˈax laj jcˈaslemal y tixambˈer chwij , taˈ tioc pire ajtijol ribˈ chwij .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: Wi wiˈ jono chawechak tran jono richoch subˈlaj nim , ¿ taˈcˈu tijchomorsaj nabˈe nen jnimal pwak tichocon jwiˈl , wi ton ranaˈ jpwaak o taˈn ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Jwiˈl wi mitaˈ tran jpwaak , xike tijchol jbˈanic y taˈ tijqˈuis jbˈanic . Cuando tiilsaj jwiˈl cristian chi taˈ chiquiˈ ticwin chi jqˈuisic , tijtzeˈjtak jwich

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: y tijbˈijtak chirij : Man winak xike xchol jbˈanic man richoch , pero taˈ chiquiˈ xcwin chi jqˈuisic , ticheˈtak chirij .

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: Wi wiˈ jono rey raj tibˈe chˈoˈjin riqˈui jono rey chic , ¿ taˈcˈu tijchomorsaj nabˈe wi ticwiniˈ lajuj mil ( 10 , 000 ) chi soldad chi chˈoˈj riqˈui junwinak mil ( 20 , 000 ) chi soldad ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Tijchomorsaj wi mitaˈ ticwin mak soldad chi chˈoˈj , aj najiˈ ajquiˈ chi taw mak jcontre cuando tijtakbˈi jono jtakoˈn chi jbˈij re man rey chi ticantak pi utzil pire maˈ tichˈoˈjintak .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Y jiˈcˈulon atak wi wiˈ jono chawechak taˈ tican jyeˈ juntir kelen re ri wiˈ , taˈ tzi tioc pire ajtijol ribˈ chwij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: Man atzˈam tziyiˈn , pero wi man atzˈam tiel jquiˈl taˈ chiquiˈ tijnaˈ tran quiˈ .

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Taˈ chiquiˈ nen tichacuj , taˈ tzi re ulew ni taˈ chiquiˈ tzi pire ticojsaj xoˈlak abono , tichak tˈojsajbˈic . Nen titonc , jteˈ jcholajl ri tambˈij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak cristian .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Mak ajtzˈonaltak alcabar pachak nicˈj ajmacbˈ xjutuntak riqˈui Kakaj Jesús chi jtaic Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri tijin tijbˈij .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Xpetak mak fariseo pach yak ajtijoltak cristian re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios , xoctak chi yokˈon chirijil Kakaj Jesús , xijtak : Man winak ri tijcˈulaˈ mak ajmacbˈ y tiwiˈn riqˈuilak , xcheˈtak chiribˈil ribˈak .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús xoc chi jbˈij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri :

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: Wi wiˈ jono chawechak wiˈ jun cient ( 100 ) jcarner y tibˈe chi jyukˈicak y etke tican saach jun rechak , re tican jyeˈ mak junmuchˈ bˈelejlajuj ( 99 ) wich takˈj y tibˈe chi jtoquic man jun ri xcan sachok asta tina jtaˈna .

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: Y cuando tibˈe jteˈch , tichak quiˈcotc , tijtˈojch rij jkul , tipetc .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Y cuando titaw laj richoch , tijtak jsiqˈuij yak richcˈulchiˈ pach yak jcˈulja y tijbˈij rechak : Quiˈcotentak wiqˈuil jwiˈl xintaˈ man incarner ri xsaachc , ticheˈ rechak .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak chi wiˈ mas quiˈcotemal lecj cuando jun ajmac tijcˈam jkˈabˈal jmac chiwch Kakaj Dios chiwchak yak junmuchˈ bˈelejlajuj ( 99 ) cristian ri qˈuexelchak jnoˈjak jwiˈlak y sucˈulchak ranmak chiwch Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic : Wi wiˈ jono anm wiˈ lajuj ( 10 ) jpwaak y tijtzak jun jpwaak la ja , ¿ taˈcˈu tijtzij jkˈakˈ chi jtoquic ? Y , ¿ taˈcˈu tioc chi jmesic jpam richoch y tijtoc jpwaak laj mes asta tina jtaˈna ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Y cuando tijtaˈ man pwak , tijtak jsiqˈuij juntir yak richcˈulchiˈ pach yak jcˈulja y tijbˈij rechak : Quiˈcotentak wiqˈuil jwiˈl xintaˈ impwaak ri xintzakc , ticheˈ rechak .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak , cuando wiˈ jono ajmac tijcˈam jkˈabˈal jmac chiwch Kakaj Dios , yak ranjl Kakaj Dios subˈlaj tiquiˈcottak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic jun esbˈi noˈj rechak cristian jilonri : Wiˈ jun winak wiˈ quibˈ jcˈajol .

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: Xpe man kˈunixel , xij re jkaj : Tat , jach chwe lajori lawiˈ ri textament ri tajach chwe nen or , xcheˈ re jkaj . Xpe jkajak , xjach chiwchak nen jnimakl titoˈntak chi quibˈ ribˈilak .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: Ajriˈke quibˈ uxibˈ kˈij jjachic textament rechak , xpe man kˈunixel xoc chi jcˈayaj lawiˈ ri xjachsaj re . Xcˈambˈi man pwak li , xeˈ chinaj li jun tilmit chic . Claˈ xoc chi jsachic jpwaak lak etzltak kelen ri raj re tran laj jcˈaslemal .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Man cˈojol winak li xqˈuis juntir jpwaak chi sachem . Xpe jun nimlaj wiˈjal li tilmit ri lamas wiˈw , re subˈlaj xcˈok jwiˈl wiˈjal .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: Xeˈ jtzˈonaj jchac riqˈui jun winak claˈ . Xpe man winak li , xtakbˈi chi rilbˈej aak laj rulew .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Man cˈojol winak li subˈlaj ticam jwiˈl wiˈjal , rajti ranm tijtij man jloˈ aak , pero taˈ tiyeˈsaj luwar re tijtij .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ xcuxtaj jwiˈl , xoc chi jchomorsaj laj ranm y xij : Subˈlaj mocom wiˈ riqˈui inkaj , rechak taˈ ajlal jwaak tijtijtak y rucˈ in incam jwiˈl wiˈjal neri .

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Lajori inkˈaj la ja riqˈui inkaj y tambˈij re : Tat , cuy immac , xintocaˈ immac chiwch Kakaj Dios y chawch at .

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: Taˈ chiquiˈ ticˈular pi we tabˈij chi iniˈ acˈajol , in acojeˈ pi jun amocom , incheˈ re , xcheˈ laj ranm .

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: Jilonli xchomorsaj xkˈaj la ja riqˈui jkaj . Aj najiˈ wiˈw re ja cuando xilsajbˈi jwiˈl jkaj y jkaj cuando xril jwich jcˈajol , subˈlaj xril cˈur jwich . Xeˈ jol chi jcˈulic , xkˈaluj y xtzˈubˈaj .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: Xpe jcˈajol , xij : Tat , cuy immac , xintocaˈ immac chiwch Kakaj Dios y chawch at . Taˈ chiquiˈ ticˈular pi we tabˈij chi iniˈ acˈajol , xcheˈ re jkaj .

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: Xpe jkaj , xij re yak jmocom : Esajtakch jono kuslaj itzˈik claˈ , cojtak chirij laj or y cojtak jun matkˈabˈ laˈ jkˈabˈ y jxajbˈ laˈ rakan .

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: Cˈamtatakch man tioˈjlaj wacx , camsajtak , katijeˈtak , kabˈaneˈtak nimakˈij ,

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: jwiˈl incˈajol ri chinchˈol in xcamiˈn , pero nicˈ riqˈuil xcˈastasajiˈ jwich laj jcamnakl . Xsaachna , pero lajori xkˈaj chiquiˈch , xcheˈ . Jilonli xcholtak jbˈanic jun nimakˈij .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: Y man nabˈeal re jcˈajol bˈesaliˈ li chac y cuando xkˈajch , xtaw chijcˈulel ja riˈchak tijta tichak tijin kˈojom re nimakˈij la ja y xojoj .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Xpe re , xsiqˈuij jun mocom , xtzˈonaj re nen chac tijin nimakˈij la ja .

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: Man mocom xij re : Jwiˈl xyukiˈ akˈun , akajak xtak jcamsaj man tioˈjlaj wacx y xan jun nimakˈij pi re jwiˈl tziyiˈ jwich taˈ nen xtaˈw , xcheˈ re .

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: Subˈlaj xpe retzal man nabˈeal cuando xta chi jilonli xijsaj re , taˈ chiquiˈ raj tioc la ja . Xeˈna jkaj chi jbˈij re chi tioc la ja .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: Re xij re jkaj : Subˈlaj junabˈ inchacunak aacˈl y ni jun bˈwelt miti bˈanal inwiˈl ri inatakwiˈ . Y ni jun qˈuisicˈ sipal chwe awiˈl pire tambˈan jono nimakˈij pach yak wichcˈulchiˈ .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Rucˈ lajori cuando xyuk acˈajol ri , ri xeˈ jqˈuiseˈch apwaak chi sachem riqˈui mak tzˈiˈtaklaj anm , xatakaˈ jcamsaj man tioˈjlaj wacx pire jnimakˈj , xcheˈ re jkaj .

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: Jkaj xij re : At walcˈwal , at watiˈ wiqˈuil y juntir kelen we ri wiˈ awechiˈn .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Pero lajori pi jcholajliˈ tikabˈan nimakˈij chirij akˈun jwiˈl chinchˈol in xcamiˈn , pero nicˈ riqˈuil xcˈastasajiˈ jwich laj jcamnakl . Xsaachna , pero xkˈaj chiquiˈch , xcheˈ winak re jcˈajol , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic jilonri rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Wiˈ jun winak subˈlaj bˈiom y wiˈ jun jmocom wiˈ pire jbˈabˈal mocom chi jchajaj juntir kelen re . Xpetak nicˈj cristian , xeˈ jbˈijtak re man bˈiom chi man mocom li tijin tijqˈuis juntir kelen re .

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: Xpe man bˈiom , xtak jsiqˈuij man jbˈabˈal mocom y cuando xtaw man jmocom riqˈuil xtzˈonaj re : ¿ Nen tabˈij chirij ri xyuk bˈijsaj chwe jwiˈl cristian chawij ? Lajori chwaj twetemaj nen jbˈanic juntir kelen we ri jachal laj akˈbˈ inwiˈl , jwiˈl lajori ateliˈ li chac wiqˈuil , xcheˈ re man mocom .

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: Man jbˈabˈal mocom xoc chi jchomorsaj laj ranm nen tran , xij : ¿ Nen tambˈan lajori jwiˈl impatron taˈ chiquiˈ tijyeˈ inchc ? Y taˈ chiquiˈ inchokˈbˈ chi chac y wi tantzˈonaj limoxn xoˈlak bˈe , qˈuixibˈal pi we , xcheˈ .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Etke xyuk laj ranm , xij : Lajori wetamchak nen tambˈan pire incˈulsaj laj richoch jono cristian cuando inesajbˈi laj inchc neri , xcheˈ .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Xtak jsiqˈuijcak chi jujunal mak cristian ri wiˈ jcˈasak riqˈui jpatron y xtzˈonaj re man xtaw nabˈe : ¿ Jurubˈ acˈas riqˈui impatron ? xcheˈ re .

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: Y man winak ri wiˈ jcˈas , xij : Bˈelejebˈ cient riqˈui oxcˈal waxaklajuj ( 978 ) galón aceit olivo incˈas , xcheˈ . Y xpe man jbˈabˈal mocom , xij re : Coˈ ri jwujal man acˈas , lajori cubˈren y cˈam man awuj y tzˈibˈaj xilj chi quejabˈ cient riqˈui jun muchˈ bˈelejebˈ ( 489 ) galónke acˈas , xcheˈ re .

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: Cuando xtaw chic man jun ri wiˈ jcˈas , xtzˈonaj re : Y at , ¿ jurubˈ acˈas riqˈui impatron ? xcheˈ re . Man winak ri wiˈ jcˈas , xij : Jun cient ( 100 ) quintal chi trig incˈas , xcheˈ . Y xpe man jbˈabˈal mocom , xij re : Coˈ ri jwujal man acˈas , lajori cubˈren y cˈam man awuj y tzˈibˈaj xilj chi junmuchˈ ( 80 ) quintalke acˈas , xcheˈ re .

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: Cuando xta man patron nen mo mak noˈj ri tijin tran man jbˈabˈal mocom , subˈlaj xsaach jchˈol chi jtaic mak jnoˈj . Mak cristian ri retake wich ulew wiˈna mas jnoˈjak chi jchomorsaj rij mak kelen ri , chiwchak yak cristian ri wiˈtakchak chi sak jwiˈl wiˈtakchak laj jkˈabˈ Kakaj Dios .

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: Tambˈij chawechak chi cojtak mak abˈiomilak ri reke wich ulew pire atcwintak chi jtaˈic mas awichcˈulchiˈak y cuando tiqˈuis juntir abˈiomilak , wiˈ nen atcˈuluwtak li jun luwar ri taˈ jqˈuisic lamas atjekertak .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Nen jun cristian tzi tran re junquitz , tziyiˈ tran cuando tiyeˈsaj mas re . Pero nen jun cristian taˈ tzi tran re junquitz , taˈ tzi tran cuando tiyeˈsaj mas re .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Atak wi taˈ tzi tabˈantak chirij abˈiomilak ri reke wich ulew , ¿ nencˈu tiyeˈw tzˈetel bˈiomil re lecj chawechak ri taˈ jqˈuisic ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Y wi mitaˈ tzi anoˈjak chirijak mak kelen ri maˈ awechak taˈn , ¿ nencˈu tiyeˈw chawechak lawiˈ ri awechak ?

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Taˈ ni jono mocom ticwin chi chac riqˈui quibˈ patron , jwiˈl tina jxutna jun y tijlokˈaj jun chic . Ticojon chiwch jun y taˈ ticojon chiwch jun chic . Atak taˈ atcwintak chi jbˈanic lawiˈ raj Kakaj Dios tabˈantak wi tibˈe awanmak chirij bˈiomil ri reke wich ulew , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Mak fariseo cuando xtatak nen xij Kakaj Jesús , xritzˈbˈejtak jwich jwiˈl rechak riˈ bˈesal ranmak chirij jbˈiomilak .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak mak fariseo : Atak tacoj akˈijak chiwchak cristian chi sucˈuliˈ awanmak chiwch Kakaj Dios , pero Kakaj Dios retamiˈ nen achomorsaˈn laj awanmak . Nen jono cojol jkˈij jwiˈlak cristian xutuliˈ jwiˈl Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak mak fariseo .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak : Ojr riˈ xijsaj rechak cristian ri tijbˈij Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios pach ri xcan jtzˈibˈajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios asta cuando xyuk Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox . Y laˈ mak junabˈ re Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox xticarch jbˈij tzilaj jtaquil re nen mo titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian . Jwiˈliˈli subˈlaj qˈui tijin tijcoj jcowil ranmak chi jcojic jyolj Juan Ajbˈanal Jaˈtiox pire tioctak laj jkˈabˈ Kakaj Dios .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: Taˈ mas cˈax wi tisaach jwich caj pach ulew chiwch tisaach jwich junquitz re Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios pach ri xcan jtzˈibˈajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: Wi wiˈ jono winak tican jacheˈ rixokl y ticˈuliˈy chic riqˈui jun anm chic , chiwch Kakaj Dios tijin trechbˈej jun anm ri maˈ jcˈulajl taˈn . Y wi wiˈ jono winak ticˈuliˈy riqˈui man anm ri xcan jachsajok jwiˈl richjil , chiwch Kakaj Dios tijin trechbˈej jun anm ri maˈ jcˈulajl taˈn , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic : Wiˈ jun winak subˈlaj bˈiom ri tijcoj kustaklaj itzˈik y nojel kˈij tran kustaklaj comon wicˈ .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Y wiˈ jun sicˈ winak ri jbˈij Lázaro qˈuisil rij li chˈaˈcˈ y tijtzˈonaj limoxn . Re ticubˈar lak ulew chiˈ pwert riqˈui man bˈiom .

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: Y sicˈ winak li riˈ raj tijtij mak jxercˈ wa ri titzaak xeˈ mex riqˈui man bˈiom . Y tipetak mak tzˈiˈ tioctak chi jrekˈic jwich mak chˈaˈcˈ chirij sicˈ winak .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: Cuando xtaw jun kˈij xcam sicˈ winak li , xcˈamsajbˈi jwiˈlak yak anjl lamas wiˈ Abraham . Y cuando xcam man bˈiom xeˈ muksajok .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: Cuando man bˈiom tijin tijtij cˈax li man luwar ri lamas ticˈolsaj jsantilak camnakibˈ , xnaˈtunbˈic , xrilbˈi Abraham wiˈ li jun luwar subˈlaj naj y wi Lázaro riqˈuil .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: Y man bˈiom subˈlaj cow xchˈaˈwc , xijbˈi re Abraham : Kaj Abraham , ilcojoˈ cˈur inwch . Bˈan tokˈobˈ chwe , bˈij re Lázaro chi tijmuˈchcojoˈ bˈa jkˈabˈ li jaˈ y tiyuk jorobˈsaj bˈa wakˈ laˈ , jwiˈl in mas cˈax tijin tantij neri li kˈakˈ , xcheˈ man bˈiom .

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: Pero Abraham xij re : At walcˈwal , cuxtaj awiˈl chi at xatijaˈ utzil laj acˈaslemal cuando xatwaˈx wich ulew . Pero Lázaro subˈlaj cˈax xtij cuando xwaˈx wich ulew , ajriˈ neri xyuk jteˈ utzil y at ajriˈ claˈ xyuk atijeˈ cˈax .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Pero lajori wiˈ jun nimlaj xelebˈxan laj kaxoˈl aacˈlak , jwiˈliˈli taˈ ni jono rechak mak ri wiˈtak neri tijnaˈ tikˈaxtakbˈi claˈ y taˈ ni jono rechak mak ri wiˈtak claˈ tijnaˈ tikˈaxtakch neri , xcheˈ Abraham re .

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: Y man bˈiom xij chic re Abraham : Kaj Abraham , bˈan jun tokˈobˈ chwe , takbˈi Lázaro laj richoch inkaj .

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: Claˈ ajwiˈtakaˈ jobˈ yak wechˈelxic chic y tibˈe jbˈijcojoˈ rechak chi mi ran rechak chapcaˈ ximbˈan in pire maˈ tipetak neri lamas titijsaj subˈlaj cˈax , xcheˈ re Abraham .

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: Abraham xij chic re : Pi rechak wiˈ Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri xcan tzˈibˈaj jwiˈl Moisés y wiˈ Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri xcan jtzˈibˈajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios ojrtaktzij y riˈ li jcojeˈtak nen tijbˈij , xcheˈ Abraham re .

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: Y man bˈiom xij chic : Tzˈetiˈn , Kaj Abraham , pero wi wiˈ jono ticˈastasaj jwich laj jcamnakl xoˈlak camnakibˈ titaw riqˈuilak , rechak tijqˈuexaˈ jnoˈjak chiwch Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ re Abraham .

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: Pero Abraham xij chic re : Wi taˈ tijcojtak Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri xcan jtzˈibˈaj Moisés y Jyolj Kakaj Dios ri xcan jtzˈibˈajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios ojrtaktzij , riˈticˈu chic tijcojtak jyolj jun ri ticˈastasaj jwich laj jcamnakl xoˈlak camnakibˈ , xcheˈ Abraham re , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Cocˈxoˈlke wiˈ nen tibˈanow re jun cristian tikej li mac . Pero cˈur jwich jun cristian ri tibˈanow re jun chic tikej li mac jwiˈl masna cˈax tijtij .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Riˈ mas tzi tiximsajbˈi jun nimlaj abˈaj re queˈm chi jkul y titˈojsajbˈi li mar chiwch tran chi timacun yak ri taˈ mas nim jkˈijak ri cubˈul jchˈolak chwij .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: ¡ Atak cwentijke aybˈak ! Wi wiˈ jono awechˈelxic chwij tibˈanow cˈax chawe , kˈel chirij ri tijin tran y wi tijqˈuex jnoˈj , cuy jmac .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: Y wi wiˈ jun kˈij tran wukubˈ ( 7 ) bˈwelt cˈax chawe y wukubˈ ( 7 ) bˈwelt tiyuk aacˈl chi jtzˈonaj jcuyic jmac chawch y tijbˈij : Cuy immac , taˈ chiquiˈ tambˈan , ticheˈ chawe , cuy jmac , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Y yak jtakoˈn Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl xijtak re : Yeˈ mas jcubˈarbˈ kachˈol chawij , xcheˈtak re .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl xij rechak : Witi cubˈul achˈolak chwij chapcaˈ jnimal jun ra bˈakˈ jwich mostas , atcwintakaˈ tabˈijtak re man nim cheˈ ri , jilonri : Bˈukˈbˈi aybˈ neri y tibˈe atiqueˈ aybˈ li mar , atcheˈtak re y man cheˈ ticojoniˈ chawchak , xcheˈ rechak .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak yak jtakoˈn : Y wi wiˈ jono chawechak wiˈ jono jmocom tijtakbˈi li chac chirij wacx o tijtakbˈi chi jyukˈic rawj y cuando tikˈajch man mocom li , taˈ tijbˈij re man mocom : Tzaj , cubˈren , tij aw , taˈ ticheˈ re .

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Re tijbˈij : Bˈan jwaˈx wa re tantij re sinar y yeˈch bˈa mex , incolajna in nabˈe , ajrucˈreˈ tatij chic aw at , ticheˈ re .

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Y taˈ rajwax ticˈomowaj re man mocom li jwiˈl riˈ xan juntir nen ri xijsaj re .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Y jiˈcˈulon atak cuando tabˈantak juntir ri tijbˈij Kakaj Dios chawechak , bˈijtak : Oj , ojke mocom ri taˈ nen ojchoconwiˈ , jwiˈl xike xkabˈan lawiˈ raj Kakaj Dios xkabˈan , atcheˈtak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Kakaj Jesús cuando bˈenam re Jerusalén xkˈaxbˈi laj xoˈlak Samaria pach Galilea .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Cuando xtaw li jun luwar , xpetak lajuj ( 10 ) chi winak chi jcˈulic , wiˈ yajel chirijak ri jbˈij lepra . Mak winak li taˈ xjutuntak chijcˈulel Kakaj Jesús , jiˈke xwaˈrtakch chinaj re ,

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: xijtakch re : Kaj Jesús Ajtijonl , il cˈur kawch riqˈui kayaj , xcheˈtakch re Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Kakaj Jesús cow xrilbˈi mak winak y xij rechak : Jattak , cˈutta aybˈak chiwchak yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios , xcheˈ rechak . Rechak xeˈtak y cuando bˈesaltak lak bˈe bˈenam rechak riqˈui yak ajcˈamaltak jbˈeak cristian riqˈui Kakaj Dios , xel man yajel chirijak y xtzibˈtak .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Jun rechak mak winak li cuando xril chi xtzibˈiˈn , xkˈaj riqˈui Kakaj Jesús , tichak chˈejej chi jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios .

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Y cuando xtaw riqˈui Kakaj Jesús xxucaj ribˈ chiwch y xxulbˈaˈ jcaybˈal asta xtaw chiˈ jwich lak ulew chi jcˈomowaj re chi xtzibˈiˈn . Y man winak li aj Samariayiˈn .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij : ¿ Miti lajujiˈ ribˈilak mak winak ri xtzibˈtak ? ¿ Lacˈumas xeˈtak mak bˈelejebˈ chic ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: ¿ Xicˈuke jun winak ri , ri maˈ rijajl taˈ Israel xkˈajch chi jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios chi xtzibˈiˈn ? xcheˈ .

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij re man winak : Bˈiiten y jat laj awichoch , xattzibˈiˈ jwiˈl xcubˈar achˈol chwij , xcheˈ .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Mak fariseo xtzˈonajtak re Kakaj Jesús nen or tipe jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian wich ulew . Y Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian wich ulew taˈ tiilsaj cuando tipetc .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Ni jonok tibˈin chi wiˈ neri o wiˈ jili , jwiˈl jtakon Kakaj Dios wiˈchak chaxoˈlak , xcheˈ re mak fariseo .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Y xij chic rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Tina tawna jun kˈij atak rajti awanmak wiˈti chic chaxoˈlak Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil , pero taˈ chiquiˈ tawiltak jwich .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Y wi wiˈ cristian tibˈin chawechak : Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil wiˈ neri o wiˈ jili , ticheˈtak , pero ma cojowtak y mat bˈetak chi rilic .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Jwiˈl cuando titaw kˈij tipe chic wich ulew Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil , jilon jpetic chapcaˈ jun coyop tijkopajch ribˈ li jun lad re caj , tijsakabˈsajiˈ juntir xeˈ caj .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Pero nabˈe tina jtijna subˈlaj cˈax y tina xutsajna jwiˈlak mak cristian ri wiˈtak re mak junabˈ lajori .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: Y cuando titaw kˈij tipe chic wich ulew Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil , cristian tranaˈtakaˈ chapcaˈ xantak cristian laˈ mak junabˈ cuando xwaˈx Noé wich ulew .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Mak cristian li xtakejtak jbˈanic lawiˈ rajak rechak trantak . Rechak tiwiˈntak , tikˈabˈartak , ticˈuliˈytak y tijcˈulbˈaˈ ralcˈwalak asta cuando xtaw kˈij xjaw Noé li arc . Xchol jun nimlaj kˈalaj y xsaach jwich juntir ri wiˈtak wich ulew .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: Jilon trantak chapcaˈ xantak mak cristian laˈ mak junabˈ cuando xwaˈx Lot li tilmit Sodoma . Mak cristian li xeˈ ranmak chirij jwaak , chirij kˈabˈric , chirij lokˈomanc , chirij cˈayinc , chirij ticoˈn y chi bˈanojtak ja .

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Pero cuando xelbˈi Lot li tilmit Sodoma xpe kˈol pach kˈakˈ lecj , xkej chibˈ man tilmit li y juntir mak cristian ri wiˈtak li man tilmit xsaach jwichak li kˈakˈ .

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Y cuando tikˈaj chicch wich ulew Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil jilon cˈax li tijtijtak mak cristian ri taˈ ticojontak chiwch Kakaj Dios .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: Y cuando titaw kˈij li , nen wiˈ bˈa ja , mi oc chic chi resaj kelen re la ja y nen wiˈ lak chac mi kˈaj chic laj richoch .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Riˈ cuxtaj awiˈlak nen xansaj re rixokl Lot ojr .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Nen jono cristian taˈ raj tijyeˈ ribˈ pi camic jwiˈlke tran lawiˈ raj Kakaj Dios tran , tisaachiˈ jwich , pero nen tijyeˈ ribˈ pi camic inwiˈl in , ticolmajiˈn .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: In tambˈij chawechak cuando titaw kˈij li , li jun akˈabˈ wiˈtak quibˈ chi waraj chibˈ jun chˈat , jun ticˈamsajbˈic y jun tican yeˈsajok .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Y wiˈ quibˈ anm , nicˈ tijintak chi queˈm , jun ticˈamsajbˈic y jun tican yeˈsajok .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Y wiˈtak quibˈ winak , nicˈ tijintak li chac , jun ticˈamsajbˈic y jun tican yeˈsajok , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Cuando xtatak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij chi jilonli xij , xtzˈonajtak re : Kajawl , ¿ lacˈumas tibˈanwiˈ jilonli ? xcheˈ rechak . Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Lamas wiˈ jun camnak awaj , claˈ tijmulbˈaˈ ribˈak mak cˈuch , xcheˈ rechak .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij pire tijcˈut chiwchak chi rajwaxiˈ cocˈxoˈlke tichˈaˈwtak riqˈui Kakaj Dios y taˈ tijquibˈaj ranmak .

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: Xij rechak : Wiˈ jun kˈatbˈitzij xwaˈx li jun tilmit , taˈ tijcoj jkˈij Kakaj Dios y taˈ tijcoj jkˈij ni jun cristian .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: Y li man tilmit li wiˈ jun anm ri camnak richjil , sicˈ anm li qˈuilaj bˈwelt titaw riqˈui man kˈatbˈitzij chi jtzˈonaj kˈatbˈitzij , re riˈ raj tibˈan kˈatbˈitzij chirij jun jcontre .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Man kˈatbˈitzij xeˈ quibˈ uxibˈ kˈij taˈ raj tran jkˈatbˈitzij chirij , pero cuando xtaw jun kˈij xqˈuistaj ranm chi rilic sicˈ anm , xij laj ranm : Onque taˈ tancoj jkˈij Kakaj Dios y taˈ tancoj jkˈijak mak cristian ,

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: pero jwiˈl man anm ri , ri camnak richjil , nojel kˈij tiyuk chi jtzˈonaj kˈatbˈitzij chwe , lajori tambˈan kˈatbˈitzij chirij man jcontre jwiˈl wi mitaˈ tambˈan kˈatbˈitzij chirij man jcontre tiqˈuistaj wanm jwiˈl nojel kˈij tiyuk wiqˈuil , xcheˈ man kˈatbˈitzij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Y Kakaj Jesús ri Kajawl xij chic rechak : Tatak jcholajl nen xij man kˈatbˈitzij ri taˈ sucˈul ranm chiwch Kakaj Dios .

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Y , ¿ riˈticˈu chic Kakaj Dios maˈ tijtˈoˈ laj or yak cristian ri chaˈl jwiˈl ri tichˈaˈwtak riqˈuil chi lakˈj chi lakˈabˈ ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Pero in tambˈij chawechak chi atjtˈowaˈtakaˈ laj or . Pero cuando tipe chic wich ulew Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil , taˈ etemal jurubˈ cristian tiyuk jteˈ ri cubˈul jchˈolak chirij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Wiˈ nicˈj rechak mak cristian ri tijbˈijtak laj ranmak chi rechak sucˈuliˈ ranmak chiwch Kakaj Dios , pero tijxuttak yak nicˈj cristian chic , jwiˈliˈli Kakaj Jesús xij jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jilonri :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: Wiˈ quibˈ winak xeˈtak li nimi richoch Kakaj Dios chi chˈaˈwem riqˈui Kakaj Dios , jun fariseo y jun ajtzˈonal alcabar .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Man fariseo pi waˈl xoc chi chˈaˈwem riqˈui Kakaj Dios , xij : At , Kakaj Dios , tancˈomowaj chawe chi in , maˈ in taˈ nicˈ chapcaˈ mak nicˈj cristian chic , pur alkˈomtak y nicˈj chic pur etzl jnoˈjak re cristian y nicˈj chic tijrechbˈejtak jun cristian chic ri maˈ jcˈulajlak taˈn y maˈ in taˈ nicˈ chapcaˈ man jun ajtzˈonal alcabar ri .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: In tambˈanaˈ cacabˈ kˈij ayun re nojel xuman y nen jnimal tanchˈec , tanyaˈ jlájuj chawe , xcheˈ man fariseo .

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: Pero man ajtzˈonal alcabar xcan waˈr chinaj re man fariseo y cuando xchˈaˈw riqˈui Kakaj Dios xxulbˈaˈ jcaybˈal lak ulew . Re taˈ xbˈit jcaybˈal lecj , xike xtˈic chi jchˈol chi kˈabˈ y xij re Kakaj Dios : At , Kakaj Dios , il cˈur inwch , cuy immac . In , iniˈ jun ajmac chawch , xcheˈ .

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak chi man ajtzˈonal alcabar li , cuando xkˈaj laj richoch , sucˈulchak ranm chiwch Kakaj Dios , pero man fariseo taˈ xsucˈulabˈ ranm chiwch Kakaj Dios . Jwiˈl nen jonok tijcoj jkˈij ricˈan , taˈ ticojsaj jkˈij , pero nen taˈ tijcoj jkˈij , riˈ li ticojsaj jkˈij , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Jun kˈij xcˈamsajtakbˈi mak tral acˈl riqˈui Kakaj Jesús pire tijyeˈ jkˈabˈ laj jbˈaak , pero cuando xriltak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij , xkˈeltak mak cristian ri xcˈamowtakbˈi mak tral acˈl riqˈui Kakaj Jesús .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Pero Kakaj Jesús xsiqˈuij mak tral acˈl y xij rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij : Ma kˈeltak , yeˈtak luwar rechak mak tral acˈl tipetak wiqˈuil jwiˈl jtakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian pirechiˈ yak ri chapcaˈ tral acˈl ri .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak chi nen taˈ tijcˈul jtakon Kakaj Dios chapcaˈ jun ral acˈl taˈ tioc lamas titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Jun winak ri nim jkˈij chijxoˈlak yak rijajl Israel xtzˈonaj re Kakaj Jesús : At , Tzilaj Ajtijonl , ¿ nen rajwax tambˈan pire tantaˈ tzilaj cˈaslemal riqˈui Kakaj Dios lecj ri taˈ jqˈuisic ? xcheˈ re .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Xpe Kakaj Jesús , xtzˈonaj re : ¿ Nen chac tabˈij chwe chi iniˈ tzi ? Taˈ ni jun tzi , xike Kakaj Dios ri tzi .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Awetamiˈ Jpixbˈ Kakaj Dios ri tijbˈij jilonri : Ma wechbˈej jun jalan cristian wi maˈ acˈulajl taˈn , mat camsanc , mat alkˈanc , maˈ mol tzij chirij jun cristian y coj jkˈij akaj achuch , ticheˈ , xcheˈ re .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Man winak li xij re Kakaj Jesús : Juntir li xincojaˈch pi aj in acˈl , xcheˈ .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Cuando xta Kakaj Jesús chi jilonli xij man winak , xij chic re : Ajwiˈ jun kelen rajwax tina abˈanna . Cˈayta juntir kelen awe ri wiˈ y man rijil tajach chiwchak yak ri wiˈ rajwax rechak . Jilonli tiwaˈxiˈ subˈlaj utzil pi awe riqˈui Kakaj Dios lecj pi jqˈuexwach abˈiomil , ajrucˈreˈ atpe wiqˈuil pire atxambˈer chwij , xcheˈ re .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Man winak li , cuando xta chi jilonli xijsaj re , subˈlaj xbˈison jwiˈl subˈlaj bˈiomiˈn .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Kakaj Jesús cuando xril chi tichak bˈisonc , xij : Subˈlaj cˈax roquicak mak bˈiom lamas titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian .

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Riˈ taˈ mas cˈax jkˈaxic jun camello laj bˈakˈ jwich jun acux chiwch roquic jun bˈiom lamas titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian , xcheˈ .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Cuando mak cristian xtatak chi jilonli , xijtak re Kakaj Jesús : Wi jilonli , taˈ ni jun ticolmaj laj jkˈabˈ jmac , xcheˈtak re .

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic rechak : Pi rechak cristian taˈ ni jonok ticwinc , pero Kakaj Dios taˈ ni jun kelen maˈ ticwin chi jbˈanic , xcheˈ rechak .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Xpe Pedro , xij re Kakaj Jesús : Oj xcaniˈ kayeˈ juntir kelen ke ri wiˈ y xojxambˈeriˈ chawij , xcheˈ re .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij : Kes tzˈetel tzˈet tambˈij chawechak nen jono cristian tican jyeˈ richoch , jkaj jchuch , rechˈelxic , rixokl y ralcˈwal jwiˈlke tijbˈij nen mo titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak cristian ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: tijcˈulaˈ subˈlaj nim jqˈuixel neri wich ulew y tijtaˈ tzilaj cˈaslemal riqˈui Kakaj Dios lecj ri taˈ jqˈuisic , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xsiqˈuijbˈi pi ricˈanak yak cabˈlajuj ( 12 ) jtakoˈn y xij rechak : Lajori ojbˈetak Jerusalén lamas titawiˈ chiwch juntir ri xcan jtzˈibˈajtak yak ajkˈasaltak Jyolj Kakaj Dios chirij Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Re tijachsaj laj jkˈabˈak yak maˈ rijajl taˈ Israel , rechak tritzˈbˈejtak jwich , tijyokˈtak y tijchubˈajtak jwich .

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Tijsecˈtak y tijcamsajtak , pero laj jrox kˈij tina cˈastasajna jwich laj jcamnakl , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Pero rechak taˈ xtatak jcholajl nen tielwiˈ ri xijsaj rechak jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , jwiˈl taˈ yeˈl luwar rechak tretemajtak jcholajl .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Cuando tawem tran Kakaj Jesús Jericó , wiˈ jun sicˈ moy cubˈul chiˈ bˈe tijin tijtzˈonaj limoxn .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Cuando sicˈ moy xta chi subˈlaj cristian tijin tikˈaxtak , re xtzˈonaj rechak cristian nen tijin tibˈanc .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Mak cristian xijtak re chi Kakaj Jesús aj Nazaret tijin tikˈax claˈ .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Xpe re , cow xchˈejejc , xij : ¡ Kaj Jesús , Jcˈajol David , il cˈur inwch ! xcheˈ .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Xpetak mak cristian ri nabˈetakbˈic , xkˈeltak , riˈ rajak taˈ chiquiˈ tichˈaˈwc , pero mas chiquiˈ cow xchˈejejc , xij chic : ¡ Jcˈajol David , il cˈur inwch ! xcheˈ .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Kakaj Jesús xwaˈrc , xtak jcˈamic sicˈ moy . Cuando xtaw sicˈ moy chijcˈulel , xtzˈonaj re :

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: ¿ Nen chawaj tambˈan chawe ? xcheˈ re . Sicˈ moy xij : Wajawl , chwaj innaˈtunc , xcheˈ re .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij chic re : Naˈtunok . Xattzibˈiˈ jwiˈl xcubˈar achˈol chwij , xcheˈ re .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Y sicˈ moy laj or xnaˈtunc y xambˈerbˈi chirij Kakaj Jesús , tichak tijin chi jbˈixaj jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios . Y jilon juntir mak cristian ri xiliwtak nen xansaj re sicˈ moy , xbˈixajtak jnimirsaj jkˈij Kakaj Dios .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Kakaj Jesús bˈenam re xkˈaxbˈi li man tilmit Jericó .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Y claˈ wiˈ jun bˈiomlaj winak ri jbˈij Zaqueo , ri jbˈabˈalak mak ajtzˈonaltak alcabar .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Y Zaqueo riˈ raj tijchˈobˈ jwich Kakaj Jesús , pero taˈ tijnaˈ tril jwich chijxoˈlak subˈlaj cristian jwiˈl re taˈ naj rakan .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Jwiˈliˈli xnabˈer jol , riˈ raj tril jwich , xeˈ jaw bˈa jun cheˈ ri jbˈij sicómoro ri wiˈ chiˈ bˈe lamas tikˈaxwiˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Cuando Kakaj Jesús xkˈax claˈ , xnaˈtunjaˈ bˈa cheˈ y xij re Zaqueo : Zaqueo , kejench laj or , lajori rajwaxiˈ tambˈan imposad laj awichoch , xcheˈ re .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Ajrucˈreˈ Zaqueo xkejch laj or bˈa cheˈ , tiquiˈcot xyuk jcˈuleˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Y juntir cristian , cuando xriltak jilonli , xoctak chi yokˈon chirijil Kakaj Jesús , xijtak : Winak ri xeˈ raneˈ jposad laj richoch jun ajmac , xcheˈtak .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Xpe Zaqueo , xwabˈaˈ ribˈ chiwch Kakaj Jesús , xij re : Wajawl , lajori pajnicˈj re juntir kelen we ri wiˈ tanjachaˈ chiwchak yak ri wiˈ rajwax rechak y wi wiˈ cristian xinsubˈtak pire xwesaj mas pwak chirijak , tankˈasajiˈ jqˈuixel cajmul rechak mas chiwch ri jnimal ri xwesaj chirijak , xcheˈ re .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij : Lajori yak cristian ri wiˈtak la ja neri xcolmajtakaˈ laj jkˈabˈ jmacak , jwiˈl winak ri tzˈetel rijajliˈ Abraham .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Jcˈajol Kakaj Dios ri xwux pi cristianil xpe wich ulew pirechiˈ tiyuk jtoqueˈ yak ri sacheˈltak jwiˈl jmacak pire ticolmajtak laj jkˈabˈ jmacak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús rechak .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Cuando yak cristian tijin tijtatak nen tijbˈij Kakaj Jesús , xpe Kakaj Jesús xij chic jun esbˈi noˈj rechak jwiˈl tawem trantak Jerusalén y yak cristian chijchˈol rechak laj or triltak titakon Kakaj Dios chibˈak .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Kakaj Jesús xij rechak : Wiˈ jun winak nim jkˈij xeˈ chinaj li jun jalan tilmit chic pire tiyeˈsaj rekleˈn pire tioc re rey laj jtilmit , ajrucˈreˈ tikˈaj chicch .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Cuando bˈenam tran xsiqˈuij lajuj ( 10 ) rechak mak jmocom . Xcan jyeˈ jujun pwak rechak chi jujunalak subˈlaj nim jwich y xij rechak : Yecomantak laˈ man pwak ri asta cuando inkˈaj chicch , xcheˈ rechak .

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Pero mak cristian laj tilmit taˈ rajak jwich man winak li y chirij re xtaktak chicbˈi nicˈj cristian chi jbˈij li man tilmit li , jilonri : Oj taˈ chikaj tioc man winak li pire karey laj katilmit , xcheˈtak .

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: Pero re xyeˈsajiˈ rekleˈn pire rey y xkˈaj chicch laj jtilmit . Y cuando xtaw laj jtilmit , xtak jsiqˈuijcak mak jmocom ri quiek re xcan jyeˈ jpwaak cuando xecˈ , jwiˈl raj tretemaj nen jnimakl xchˈectak chirij man pwak chi jujunalak .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Cuando xtaw man nabˈe mocom ri quiek re xcan jyeˈ pwak , xij re : Kaj , apwaak ri xcan ayeˈ chwe , xchˈecaˈ lajuj ( 10 ) jqˈuiyal chapcaˈ xcan ayeˈ chwe , xcheˈ re .

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: Y man rey xij re : Tziyiˈ xabˈan , atiˈ jun tzilaj mocom . Jwiˈl tziyiˈ xabˈan re jun raquitz , lajori atoc pire kˈatbˈitzij chibˈ lajuj ( 10 ) chi tilmit , xcheˈ re .

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: Xtaw man jcabˈ mocom chic , xij re : Kaj , apwaak ri xcan ayeˈ chwe , xchˈecaˈ jobˈ jqˈuiyal chapcaˈ xcan ayeˈ chwe , xcheˈ re .

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: Xpe man rey , xij re man mocom li : At , atoc pire kˈatbˈitzij chibˈ jobˈ tilmit , xcheˈ re .

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: Pero xtaw man jun mocom chic , xij re : Kaj , coˈ apwaak ri . Ximpis li jun sutˈ y xincˈol ,

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: jwiˈl xtzaak inchˈol chi jcojic jwiˈl wetamiˈ chi mas at cˈaˈn y atochˈon lamas taˈ nen tiquil awiˈl , xcheˈ man mocom re man rey .

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: Xpe man rey , xij re man mocom li : At , atiˈ jun etzl mocom y ayolj titzˈonin kˈatbˈitzij chawij , jwiˈl wi awetamiˈ chi masiˈ in cˈaˈn y inochˈon lamas taˈ tiquil inwiˈl ,

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: xacˈamteneˈbˈi impwaak xeˈteneˈ ayeˈ pi kejom re jonok y cuando xinyuk wiˈteneˈchak ral impwaak roj xincˈuleˈ , xcheˈ re .

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: Xpe man rey , xij rechak yak cristian ri wiˈtak claˈ : Majtak man pwak re y yeˈtak re man immocom ri xchˈecow lajuj ( 10 ) jqˈuiyal chapcaˈ ri jqˈuiyal impwaak xcan inyeˈ re , xcheˈ .

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: Y yak cristian ri wiˈtak claˈ , xijtak re : Kaj , pero re wiˈchak lajuj ( 10 ) jqˈuiyal chapcaˈ ri jqˈuiyal apwaak xcan ayeˈ re , xcheˈtak re .

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Man rey xij chic rechak : In tambˈij chawechak nen wiˈ mas riqˈuil , tiyeˈsaj chiquiˈ mas re , pero nen taˈ re , asta raquitz ri wiˈ riqˈuil , timajsajiˈ re .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Y tambˈij chawechak chi mak cristian ri incontrintak ri taˈ rajak inoc pire rey laj jtilmitak , cˈamtatakch y tacamsajtak chinwch , xcheˈ man rey rechak , xcheˈ Kakaj Jesús .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Cuando xijmaj jilonli jwiˈl Kakaj Jesús , xnabˈer chiwchak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij xeˈ Jerusalén .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Y cuando xtaw chijcˈulel man tilmit Betfagé y man tilmit Betania ri wiˈtak wich witz ri jbˈij Olivos , xtakbˈi quibˈ rechak yak ajtijol ribˈak chirij .
